abs.name: Abs
abs.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

acccontrol.name: AccControl
acccontrol.doc: Controls accumulators, for example, motor run hours. You can reset the values of Run Time, Totalizer Inc, and Number of Starts (defined in the Accumulator database), re-read these values from the I/O device, or flush pending writes of these values to the I/O device.

accumbrowseclose.name: AccumBrowseClose
accumbrowseclose.doc: The AccumBrowseClose function terminates an active data browse session and cleans up all resources associated with the session.

accumbrowsefirst.name: AccumBrowseFirst
accumbrowsefirst.doc: The AccumBrowseFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

accumbrowsegetfield.name: AccumBrowseGetField
accumbrowsegetfield.doc: The AccumBrowseGetField function retrieves the value of the specified field from the record the data browse cursor is currently referencing.

accumbrowsenext.name: AccumBrowseNext
accumbrowsenext.doc: The AccumBrowseNext function moves the data browse cursor forward one record.

accumbrowsenumrecords.name: AccumBrowseNumRecords
accumbrowsenumrecords.doc: The AccumBrowseNumRecords function returns the number of records that match the filter criteria.

accumbrowseopen.name: AccumBrowseOpen
accumbrowseopen.doc: The AccumBrowseOpen function initiates a new browse session and returns a handle to the new session that can be used in subsequent data browse function calls.

accumbrowseprev.name: AccumBrowsePrev
accumbrowseprev.doc: The AccumBrowsePrev function moves the data browse cursor back one record.

alarmackrec.name: AlarmAckRec
alarmackrec.doc: Acknowledges alarms by record number on both the primary and standby alarm servers.

alarmack.name: AlarmAck
alarmack.doc: Acknowledges alarms. You can acknowledge the alarm where the cursor is positioned, one or more alarm lists on the active page, a whole category of alarms, or alarms of a particular priority.

alarmactive.name: AlarmActive
alarmactive.doc: Determines if any alarms are active in the user's area.

alarmcatgetformat.name: AlarmCatGetFormat
alarmcatgetformat.doc: Returns the display format string of the specified alarm category.

alarmclear.name: AlarmClear
alarmclear.doc: Clears an acknowledged (and off) alarm from the active alarm list.

alarmclearrec.name: AlarmClearRec
alarmclearrec.doc: Clears an alarm by its record number on both the primary and standby alarms servers.

alarmcleartag.name: AlarmClearTag
alarmcleartag.doc: Clears alarms by tag on both the primary and standby alarms servers.

alarmcomment.name: AlarmComment
alarmcomment.doc: Allows an operator to add a comment to a selected alarm summary or SOE entry during runtime. You would normally call this function from a keyboard command.

alarmcommentrecid.name: AlarmCommentRecID
alarmcommentrecid.doc: Allows an operator to add a comment to a selected alarm summary or SOE entry during runtime. You would normally call this function from a keyboard command.

alarmcount.name: AlarmCount
alarmcount.doc: Counts the available alarms for the selected filter criteria.

alarmcountequipment.name: AlarmCountEquipment
alarmcountequipment.doc: Counts the available alarms for the given equipments in conjunction with the selected filter criteria.

alarmdelete.name: AlarmDelete
alarmdelete.doc: Deletes alarm summary entries that are currently displayed.

alarmdisable.name: AlarmDisable
alarmdisable.doc: Disables alarms. You can disable the alarm where the cursor is positioned, one or more alarm lists on the active page, a whole category of alarms, or alarms of a particular priority.

alarmdisablerec.name: AlarmDisableRec
alarmdisablerec.doc: Disables alarms by record number on both the Primary and Standby Alarms Servers.

alarmdisabletag.name: AlarmDisableTag
alarmdisabletag.doc: Disables alarms by Tag on both the Primary and Standby Alarms Servers.

alarmdsp.name: AlarmDsp
alarmdsp.doc: Displays an alarm list, starting at a specified AN and then on subsequent ANs.

alarmdspclusteradd.name: AlarmDspClusterAdd
alarmdspclusteradd.doc: Adds a cluster to a client's alarm list. Alarms in the specified cluster (that correspond to the mode set in AlarmDsp) will be added to the alarm list at the AN number.

alarmdspclusterinuse.name: AlarmDspClusterInUse
alarmdspclusterinuse.doc: Determines if a cluster is included in a client's alarm list.

alarmdspclusterremove.name: AlarmDspClusterRemove
alarmdspclusterremove.doc: Removes a cluster from a client's alarms list. Alarms for the specified cluster will be removed from the alarms list at the AN number.

alarmdsplast.name: AlarmDspLast
alarmdsplast.doc: Displays the latest  alarms, at a specified AN with the cluster name. Use this function to display the last alarms.

alarmdspnext.name: AlarmDspNext
alarmdspnext.doc: Displays the next page of alarms. This function pages down (scrolls) the alarms displayed by the AlarmDsp() function. You would normally call this function from a keyboard command.

alarmdspprev.name: AlarmDspPrev
alarmdspprev.doc: Displays the previous page of alarms. This function pages up (scrolls) the alarms displayed by the AlarmDsp() function. You would normally call this function from a keyboard command.

alarmenable.name: AlarmEnable
alarmenable.doc: Enables an alarm on the active alarm list. You can enable the alarm where the cursor is positioned, one or more alarm lists on the active page, a whole category of alarms, or alarms of a particular priority.

alarmenablerec.name: AlarmEnableRec
alarmenablerec.doc: Enables alarms by record number on both the Primary and Standby Alarms Servers.

alarmenabletag.name: AlarmEnableTag
alarmenabletag.doc: Enables alarms by Tag on both the Primary and Standby Alarms Servers.

alarmeventque.name: AlarmEventQue
alarmeventque.doc: Opens the alarm event queue. The Alarms Server writes events into this queue as they are processed. These events include activated, reset, acknowledged, enabled and disabled alarms.

alarmfilterclose.name: AlarmFilterClose
alarmfilterclose.doc: This function removes the named filter from memory.

alarmfiltereditappend.name: AlarmFilterEditAppend
alarmfiltereditappend.doc: The AlarmFilterEditAppend function takes a session handle and a filter expression as parameters. It appends the provided expression to the current filter session content without any validation.

alarmfiltereditappendequipment.name: AlarmFilterEditAppendEquipment
alarmfiltereditappendequipment.doc: The AlarmFilterEditAppendEquipment function takes a session handle and a filter expression as parameters. It appends the provided expression to the current filter session content without any validation.

alarmfiltereditclose.name: AlarmFilterEditClose
alarmfiltereditclose.doc: The AlmFilterEditClose function removes the session from the memory. The filter is not reset and is valid until a new filter is created and applied.

alarmfiltereditcommit.name: AlarmFilterEditCommit
alarmfiltereditcommit.doc: The AlarmFilterEditCommit function takes a session handle as parameter. It validate the filter created in this session and, if valid, applies this filter to the list associated with the session.

alarmfiltereditfirst.name: AlarmFilterEditFirst
alarmfiltereditfirst.doc: This function takes a session handle parameter.  It gets the first part of the filter.

alarmfiltereditlast.name: AlarmFilterEditLast
alarmfiltereditlast.doc: This function takes a session handle parameter.  It gets the last part of the filter.

alarmfiltereditnext.name: AlarmFilterEditNext
alarmfiltereditnext.doc: This function takes a session handle parameter.  It gets the next part of the filter.

alarmfiltereditopen.name: AlarmFilterEditOpen
params: STRING FilterName or INT AN or INT -1
alarmfiltereditopen.doc: The AlmFilterEditOpen function creates a session for the historical list (or lists) associated with the provided animation number (AN) or FilterName or all alarm lists displayed on the page via (-1) option.

alarmfiltereditprev.name: AlarmFilterEditPrev
alarmfiltereditprev.doc: This function takes a session handle parameter.  It gets the previous part of the filter.

alarmfiltereditset.name: AlarmFilterEditSet
alarmfiltereditset.doc: The AlarmFilterEditSet function takes a session handle and a filter expression as parameters. It replaces the current filter session content by the provided expression without any validation.

alarmfilterform.name: AlarmFilterForm
alarmfilterform.doc: Displays a form for specifying filtering criteria for either an alarm list or a named filter. This function uses the AlarmFilterEdit family of Cicode functions to set the filter.

alarmfilteropen.name: AlarmFilterOpen
alarmfilteropen.doc: This function creates a named filter. The filter is initialized with empty content (matches all alarms). If unable to open the named filter  an error code is returned.

alarmfirstcatrec.name: AlarmFirstCatRec
alarmfirstcatrec.doc: Searches for the first occurrence of an alarm category and type. You can search all areas, the current area only, or specify an area to limit the search.

alarmfirstprirec.name: AlarmFirstPriRec
alarmfirstprirec.doc: Searches for the first occurrence of an alarm priority and type. You can search all areas, the current area only, or specify an area to limit the search.

alarmfirsttagrec.name: AlarmFirstTagRec
alarmfirsttagrec.doc: Searches for the first occurrence of an alarm tag, name, and description.

alarmgetdelay.name: AlarmGetDelay
alarmgetdelay.doc: Gets the delay setting for the alarm the cursor is currently positioned over.

alarmgetdelayrec.name: AlarmGetDelayRec
alarmgetdelayrec.doc: Gets the delay setting for an alarm via the alarm record number.

alarmgetdsp.name: AlarmGetDsp
alarmgetdsp.doc: Gets field data from the alarm record that is displayed at the specified AN.

alarmgetfieldrec.name: AlarmGetFieldRec
alarmgetfieldrec.doc: Gets the contents of the specified field in the specified alarm record.

alarmgetfiltername.name: AlarmGetFilterName
alarmgetfiltername.doc: Retrieves the name of the  linked named filter for the supplied An. If empty text, there is currently no linked named filter.

alarmgetinfo.name: AlarmGetInfo
alarmgetinfo.doc: Gets data on the alarm list displayed at a specified AN. Use this function to display the current alarm list information on an alarm page. If only one alarm list has been configured on an alarm page, modes 2 and 3 of this function return the current alarm page information.

alarmgetorderbykey.name: AlarmGetOrderbyKey
alarmgetorderbykey.doc: Retrieves the list of key(s) that are used to determine the order of the alarm list. These keys can be set by the AlarmSetInfo() function.

alarmgetthreshold.name: AlarmGetThreshold
alarmgetthreshold.doc: Gets the threshold of the analog alarm where the cursor is positioned.

alarmgetthresholdrec.name: AlarmGetThresholdRec
alarmgetthresholdrec.doc: Gets the threshold of analog alarms by the alarm record number.

alarmhelp.name: AlarmHelp
alarmhelp.doc: Displays the alarm help page (associated with the alarm) where the cursor is positioned. You can assign a help page to each alarm when you define it (using the Digital Alarms or the Analog Alarms database, depending on the type of alarm). You need to also define the help page in the Pages database.

alarmlistcreate.name: AlarmListCreate
alarmlistcreate.doc: Creates an alarms list at a specified AN.

alarmlistdestroy.name: AlarmListDestroy
alarmlistdestroy.doc: Destroys an alarms list at a specified AN.

alarmlistdisplay.name: AlarmListDisplay
alarmlistdisplay.doc: Displays an alarms list at a specified AN.

alarmlistfill.name: AlarmListFill
alarmlistfill.doc: Fills an alarms list at a specified AN to be used by another routine.

alarmnextcatrec.name: AlarmNextCatRec
alarmnextcatrec.doc: Searches for the next occurrence of an alarm category and type, commencing with the specified alarm record identifier (returned from the previous search through the AlarmFirstCatRec function).

alarmnextprirec.name: AlarmNextPriRec
alarmnextprirec.doc: Searches for the next occurrence of an alarm of a specified priority and type, commencing with the specified alarm record identifier (returned from the previous search through the AlarmFirstPriRec() function).

alarmnexttagrec.name: AlarmNextTagRec
alarmnexttagrec.doc: Searches for the next occurrence of an alarm tag, name, and description, starting with the alarm record identifier (returned from the previous search through the AlarmFirstTagRec() function).

alarmnotifyvarchange.name: AlarmNotifyVarChange
alarmnotifyvarchange.doc: This function is used to provide time-stamped digital and time-stamped analog alarms with data. When called, it notifies the alarm server that the specified variable tag has changed.

alarmqueryfirstrec.name: AlarmQueryFirstRec
alarmqueryfirstrec.doc: Searches for the first occurrence of an alarm category (or priority) and type. This is a wrapper function of AlarmFirstCatRec and AlarmFirstPriRec.

alarmquerynextrec.name: AlarmQueryNextRec
alarmquerynextrec.doc: Searches for the next occurrence of an alarm category (or priority) and type, commencing with the specified alarm record identifier (returned from the previous search through the alarm query functions).

alarmresetquery.name: AlarmResetQuery
alarmresetquery.doc: Clears the filter of the specified filter source. Used to reset the filter set up by the Cicode function AlarmFilterForm().

alarmsetdelay.name: AlarmSetDelay
alarmsetdelay.doc: Changes the delay setting for an alarm (that is Delay, High High Delay, Deviation Delay, etc.). This function acts on the alarm that the cursor is positioned over. Use this function during runtime to change the delay values that were specified in the alarms database.

alarmsetdelayrec.name: AlarmSetDelayRec
alarmsetdelayrec.doc: Changes the delay setting for an alarm (that is Delay, High High Delay, Deviation Delay, etc.) by the alarm record number. You can only call this function on an alarms server for local alarms, or on a redundant server if one has been configured.

alarmsetinfo.name: AlarmSetInfo
alarmsetinfo.doc: Controls different aspects of the alarm list displayed at a specified AN. Currently applies only to non-hardware alarm lists.

alarmsetthreshold.name: AlarmSetThreshold
alarmsetthreshold.doc: Changes the thresholds (that is High High, Low etc.) of analog alarms. This function acts on the analog alarm where the cursor is positioned. Use this function to change (at run time) the threshold values that were specified in the Analog Alarms database.

alarmsetthresholdrec.name: AlarmSetThresholdRec
alarmsetthresholdrec.doc: Changes the threshold (that is High High, Low etc.) of analog alarms by the alarm record number. You can call this function only on an Alarms Server for alarms on that server, or on the redundant server (if a redundant server is configured).

alarmsplit.name: AlarmSplit
alarmsplit.doc: Splits an alarm summary entry which has no Off time. The current entry will be given an off time equal to the time when AlarmSplit() is called, and the new entry will have the same On time, with empty Off time.

alarmsumappend.name: AlarmSumAppend
alarmsumappend.doc: Appends a new blank record to the alarm summary. Use this function to add new alarm summary entries, either for actual alarms or as special user summary entries.

alarmsumcommit.name: AlarmSumCommit
alarmsumcommit.doc: Commits the alarm summary entry to the Summary Device specified in the alarm category of the entry.

alarmsumdelete.name: AlarmSumDelete
alarmsumdelete.doc: Deletes an alarm summary entry. You identify the alarm summary entry by the Index, returned by one of the alarm summary search functions.

alarmsumfind.name: AlarmSumFind
alarmsumfind.doc: Finds the alarm summary index for an alarm that you specify by the alarm record identifier and alarm activation time (OnTime).

alarmsumfirst.name: AlarmSumFirst
alarmsumfirst.doc: Gets the index of the oldest alarm summary entry.

alarmsumget.name: AlarmSumGet
alarmsumget.doc: Gets field data from an alarm summary entry. The data is returned as a string. You identify the alarm summary entry by the Index, returned by one of the alarm summary search functions.

alarmsumlast.name: AlarmSumLast
alarmsumlast.doc: Gets the index of the most recent alarm summary entry.

alarmsumnext.name: AlarmSumNext
alarmsumnext.doc: Gets the index of the next alarm summary entry, that is, the entry that occurred later than the entry specified by Index.

alarmsumprev.name: AlarmSumPrev
alarmsumprev.doc: Gets the index of the previous alarm summary entry, that is, the entry that occurred before the entry specified by Index.

alarmsumset.name: AlarmSumSet
alarmsumset.doc: Sets field information in an alarm summary entry. You identify the alarm summary entry by the Index, returned by one of the alarm summary search functions.

alarmsumsplit.name: AlarmSumSplit
alarmsumsplit.doc: Splits the alarm summary entry identified by index.

alarmsumtype.name: AlarmSumType
alarmsumtype.doc: Retrieves a value that indicates a specified alarm's type, that is whether it's a digital alarm, an analog alarm, hardware alarm, etc.

almbrowseack.name: AlmBrowseAck
almbrowseack.doc: The AlmBrowseAck function acknowledges the alarm tag at the current cursor position in an active data browse session.

almbrowseclose.name: AlmBrowseClose
almbrowseclose.doc: The AlmBrowseClose function terminates an active data browse session and cleans up resources associated with the session.

almbrowsedisable.name: AlmBrowseDisable
almbrowsedisable.doc: The AlmBrowseDisable function disables the alarm tag at the current cursor position in an active data browse session.

almbrowseenable.name: AlmBrowseEnable
almbrowseenable.doc: The AlmBrowseEnable function enables the alarm tag at the current cursor position in an active data browse session.

almbrowsefirst.name: AlmBrowseFirst
almbrowsefirst.doc: The AlmBrowseFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

almbrowsegetfield.name: AlmBrowseGetField
almbrowsegetfield.doc: The AlmBrowseGetField function retrieves the value of the specified field from the record the data browse cursor is currently referencing.

almbrowsenext.name: AlmBrowseNext
almbrowsenext.doc: The AlmBrowseNext function moves the data browse cursor forward one record.

almbrowsenumrecords.name: AlmBrowseNumRecords
almbrowsenumrecords.doc: The AlmBrowseNumRecords function returns the number of records that match the filter criteria.

almbrowseopen.name: AlmBrowseOpen
almbrowseopen.doc: The AlmBrowseOpen function initiates a new browse session and returns a handle to the new session that can be used in subsequent data browse function calls. Use this function to browse all configured alarms.

almbrowseprev.name: AlmBrowsePrev
almbrowseprev.doc: The AlmBrowsePrev function moves the data browse cursor back one record.

almsummaryack.name: AlmSummaryAck
almsummaryack.doc: The AlmSummaryAck function acknowledges the alarm in the active alarm list which is linked to the current entry of the alarm summary browse session.

almsummaryclear.name: AlmSummaryClear
almsummaryclear.doc: The AlmSummaryClear function clears the latched alarm at the current cursor position in an active data browse session. A latched alarm is an alarm which is OFF and acknowledged when [Alarm]AckHold is set to 1.

almsummaryclose.name: AlmSummaryClose
almsummaryclose.doc: The AlmSummaryClose function terminates an active data browse session and cleans up all resources associated with the session.

almsummarycommit.name: AlmSummaryCommit
almsummarycommit.doc: The AlmSummaryCommit function triggers the actual write of the value for the field previously specified by AlmSummarySetFieldValue.

almsummarydelete.name: AlmSummaryDelete
almsummarydelete.doc: The AlmSummaryDelete function deletes the record in the filtered list that the cursor is currently referencing. The cursor moves to the next available entry in the data browse session after the current alarm summary is deleted.

almsummarydeleteall.name: AlmSummaryDeleteAll
almsummarydeleteall.doc: The AlmSummaryDeleteAll function deletes every record from the filtered list source.

almsummarydisable.name: AlmSummaryDisable
almsummarydisable.doc: The AlmSummaryDisable function disables the alarm at the current cursor position in an active data browse session.

almsummaryenable.name: AlmSummaryEnable
almsummaryenable.doc: The AlmSummaryEnable function enables the alarm at the current cursor position in an active data browse session.

almsummaryfirst.name: AlmSummaryFirst
almsummaryfirst.doc: The AlmSummaryFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

almsummarygetfield.name: AlmSummaryGetField
almsummarygetfield.doc: The AlmSummaryGetField function retrieves the value of the specified field from the record the data browse cursor is currently referencing.

almsummarylast.name: AlmSummaryLast
almsummarylast.doc: The AlmSummaryLast function places the data browse cursor at the most recent summary record from the last cluster of the available browsing cluster list.

almsummarynext.name: AlmSummaryNext
almsummarynext.doc: The AlmSummaryNext function moves the data browse cursor forward one record.

almsummarynumrecords.name: AlmSummaryNumRecords
almsummarynumrecords.doc: The AlmSummaryNumRecords function retrieves the number of records in an alarm summary browse session.

almsummaryopen.name: AlmSummaryOpen
almsummaryopen.doc: The AlmSummaryOpen function initiates a new browse session and returns a handle to the new session that can be used in subsequent data browse function calls.

almsummaryprev.name: AlmSummaryPrev
almsummaryprev.doc: The AlmSummaryPrev function moves the data browse cursor back one record.

almsummarysetfieldvalue.name: AlmSummarySetFieldValue
almsummarysetfieldvalue.doc: The AlmSummarySetFieldValue function sets a new value for the specified field for the record the data browse cursor is currently referencing. The value is not committed until a call to AlmSummaryCommit is made.

almtagsack.name: AlmTagsAck
almtagsack.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseAck instead.

almtagsclear.name: AlmTagsClear
almtagsclear.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use the AlmBrowseClear function instead.

almtagsclose.name: AlmTagsClose
almtagsclose.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseClose function instead.

almtagsdisable.name: AlmTagsDisable
almtagsdisable.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseDisable function instead.

almtagsenable.name: AlmTagsEnable
almtagsenable.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseEnable function instead.

almtagsfirst.name: AlmTagsFirst
almtagsfirst.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseFirst function instead.

almtagsgetfield.name: AlmTagsGetField
almtagsgetfield.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseGetField function instead.

almtagsnext.name: AlmTagsNext
almtagsnext.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseNext function instead.

almtagsnumrecords.name: AlmTagsNumRecords
almtagsnumrecords.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseNumRecords function instead.

almtagsopen.name: AlmTagsOpen
almtagsopen.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowseOpen function instead.

almtagsprev.name: AlmTagsPrev
almtagsprev.doc: This command is now deprecated. Use AlmBrowsePrev function instead.

anbyname.name: AnByName
anbyname.doc: Retrieves the animation point number of an ActiveX object.

arccos.name: ArcCos
arccos.doc: Calculates the arccosine of an angle.

arcsin.name: ArcSin
arcsin.doc: Calculates the arcsine of an angle.

arctan.name: ArcTan
arctan.doc: Calculates the arctangent of an angle.

areacheck.name: AreaCheck
areacheck.doc: Determines whether the current user has access to a specified area.

arraycopy.name: ArrayCopy
arraycopy.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraycreate.name: ArrayCreate
arraycreate.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraycreatebyan.name: ArrayCreateByAn
arraycreatebyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraydestroy.name: ArrayDestroy
arraydestroy.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraydestroybyan.name: ArrayDestroyByAn
arraydestroybyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arrayexists.name: ArrayExists
arrayexists.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arrayexistsbyan.name: ArrayExistsByAn
arrayexistsbyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arrayfillfromalarmdatabyan.name: ArrayFillFromAlarmDataByAn
arrayfillfromalarmdatabyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraygetarraybyan.name: ArrayGetArrayByAn
arraygetarraybyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraygetinfo.name: ArrayGetInfo
arraygetinfo.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraygetint.name: ArrayGetInt
arraygetint.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraygetintbyan.name: ArrayGetIntByAn
arraygetintbyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraygetmapname.name: ArrayGetMapName
arraygetmapname.doc: Retrieves the name of the map associated with an array.

arraygetmapnamebyan.name: ArrayGetMapNameByAn
arraygetmapnamebyan.doc: Retrieves the name of the map for an array associated with a specified AN.

arraygetstring.name: ArrayGetString
arraygetstring.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraygetstringbyan.name: ArrayGetStringByAn
arraygetstringbyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arrayisdirty.name: ArrayIsDirty
arrayisdirty.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraysetint.name: ArraySetInt
arraysetint.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraysetintbyan.name: ArraySetIntByAn
arraysetintbyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraysetisdirty.name: ArraySetIsDirty
arraysetisdirty.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraysetstring.name: ArraySetString
arraysetstring.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arraysetstringbyan.name: ArraySetStringByAn
arraysetstringbyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

arrayswap.name: ArraySwap
arrayswap.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

ass.name: Ass
ass.doc: Associates a variable tag or equipment with a Super Genie.

asschain.name: AssChain
asschain.doc: Chains the associations from the current Super Genie to a new Super Genie. Use this function to display a new Super Genie when you already have one displayed. The new Super Genie will inherit the associations of the first Super Genie.

asschainpage.name: AssChainPage
asschainpage.doc: Chains the associations from the current Super Genie to a new Super Genie, and displays the new Super Genie (in the current window).

asschainpopup.name: AssChainPopUp
asschainpopup.doc: Chains the associations from the current Super Genie to a new Super Genie, and displays the new Super Genie in a new popup window.

asschainwin.name: AssChainWin
asschainwin.doc: Chains the associations from the current Super Genie to a new Super Genie, and displays the new Super Genie in a new window. The new window will be of the same type as the current window. Use this function to display a new Super Genie in a new window when a Super Genie is already displayed. The new Super Genie will inherit the associations of the first.

asschainwinfree.name: AssChainWinFree
asschainwinfree.doc: Stores the  associations on an existing Super Genie, closes it, then assigns the tags to a new window. This allows a Super Genie popup window to call another popup window, and close the parent popup.

assequipreferences.name: AssEquipReferences
assequipreferences.doc: Creates Super Genie associations for each equipment referenced by the specified equipment.

assert.name: Assert
assert.doc: Verifies that the specified expression is TRUE. If then expression is FALSE, the current task will be halted. This is useful to help prevent the execution of code you do not want to run in the event an error has been detected.

assgetproperty.name: AssGetProperty
assgetproperty.doc: This function gets association information about the current Super Genie from the data source (that is, information about a variable tag that has been substituted into the Super Genie).

assgetscale.name: AssGetScale
assgetscale.doc: Gets scale information about the tag references for the current Super Genie from the datasource (that is scale information about a variable tag that has been substituted into the Super Genie).

assinfo.name: AssInfo
assinfo.doc: Gets association information about the current Super Genie (that is information about a variable tag that has been substituted into the Super Genie).

assinfoex.name: AssInfoEx
assinfoex.doc: Gets association information about the current Super Genie (that is information about a variable tag that has been substituted into the Super Genie).

assmetadata.name: AssMetadata
assmetadata.doc: This non-blocking function performs Super Genie associations using the "Name" and "Value" fields defined on the Object Properties - Metadata tab, and matches it to the 'Name' field in the page associations table.

assmetadatapage.name: AssMetadataPage
assmetadatapage.doc: Uses the metadata information from the current object for the page associations for a new Super Genie page, and displays the new Super Genie (in the current page).

assmetadatapopup.name: AssMetadataPopUp
assmetadatapopup.doc: Uses the metadata information from the current animation point for the associations for a new Super Genie page, and displays the new Super Genie in a pop up window.

assmetadatawin.name: AssMetadataWin
assmetadatawin.doc: Uses the metadata information from the current animation-point for the associations for a new Super Genie page, and displays the new Super Genie in a new window.

asspage.name: AssPage
asspage.doc: Associates up to eight variable tags or equipment.item tag references with a Super Genie and displays the Super Genie in the current window.

asspopup.name: AssPopUp
asspopup.doc: Associates up to eight variable tags or equipment.item tag references with a Super Genie and displays the Super Genie in a popup window.

assscalestr.name: AssScaleStr
assscalestr.doc: Gets scale information about the associations of the current Super Genie (that is scale information about a variable tag that has been substituted into the Super Genie).

asstag.name: AssTag
asstag.doc: Associates a variable tag or equipment.item tag reference with a Super Genie.

asstitle.name: AssTitle
asstitle.doc: Sets the runtime window title to the tag name of the first variable substituted into the Super Genie.

assvartags.name: AssVarTags
assvartags.doc: Associates up to eight variable tags or equipment.item tag references with a Super Genie.

asswin.name: AssWin
asswin.doc: Associates up to eight variable tags or equipment.item tag references with a Super Genie, and displays the Super Genie in a new window.

asswinreplace.name: AssWinReplace
asswinreplace.doc: Sets the runtime window title to the tag name of the first variable substituted into the Super Genie.

beep.name: Beep
beep.doc: Beeps the internal speaker or sound card (installed in the computer).

callevent.name: CallEvent
callevent.doc: Simulates an event, triggering any OnEvent() function that has the same Type argument specified.

chainevent.name: ChainEvent
chainevent.doc: Calls an event function using the function handle. This creates a chain of event handlers from a single event.

chartostr.name: CharToStr
chartostr.doc: Converts an ASCII code into a string.

citectinfo.name: CitectInfo
citectinfo.doc: Gets information about a Plant SCADA variable. This function returns internal statistics and other information about the runtime system.

clipcopy.name: ClipCopy
clipcopy.doc: Copies a string to the Windows clipboard. When the string is in the clipboard, you can paste it to any Windows program.

clippaste.name: ClipPaste
clippaste.doc: Pastes a string from the Windows clipboard.

clipreadln.name: ClipReadLn
clipreadln.doc: Reads a single line of text from the Windows clipboard. With this function, you can read a block of text from the clipboard - line by line.

clipsetmode.name: ClipSetMode
clipsetmode.doc: Sets the format of data sent to the Windows clipboard.

clipwriteln.name: ClipWriteLn
clipwriteln.doc: Writes a line of text to the Windows clipboard. With this function, you can write any amount of text to the clipboard.

clusteractivate.name: ClusterActivate
clusteractivate.doc: This function allows the user to activate an inactive cluster.

clusterdeactivate.name: ClusterDeactivate
clusterdeactivate.doc: This function allows the user to deactivate an active cluster.

clusterfirst.name: ClusterFirst
clusterfirst.doc: This function allows the user to retrieve the first configured cluster in the project.

clustergetname.name: ClusterGetName
clustergetname.doc: ClusterGetName is deprecated in this version of Plant SCADA.

clusterisactive.name: ClusterIsActive
clusterisactive.doc: This function allows the user to determine if a cluster is active.

clusternext.name: ClusterNext
clusternext.doc: This function allows the user to retrieve the next configured cluster in the project.

clusterservertypes.name: ClusterServerTypes
clusterservertypes.doc: This function allows the user to determine which servers are defined for a given cluster.

clusterstatus.name: ClusterStatus
clusterstatus.doc: This function allows the user to determine the connection status from the client to a server on a cluster.

clusterswapactive.name: ClusterSwapActive
clusterswapactive.doc: This function allows the user to deactivate an active cluster at the same time as activating an inactive cluster.

codesetmode.name: CodeSetMode
codesetmode.doc: Sets various execution modes for Cicode tasks in the current thread.

codetrace.name: CodeTrace
codetrace.doc: Traces Cicode into the Kernel and the SYSLOG.DAT file. Use this function for finding bugs in your Cicode.

comopen.name: ComOpen
comopen.doc: Opens a communication port for access.

comread.name: ComRead
comread.doc: Reads characters from a communication port.

comreset.name: ComReset
comreset.doc: Resets the communication port. This function can only be called from an I/O Server.

comwrite.name: ComWrite
comwrite.doc: Writes characters to a communication port.

cos.name: Cos
cos.doc: Calculates the trigonometric cosine of an angle.

createcontrolobject.name: CreateControlObject
createcontrolobject.doc: Creates a new instance of an ActiveX object.

createobject.name: CreateObject
createobject.doc: Creates a new instance of an ActiveX object. If you use this function to create an ActiveX object, it will have no visual component (only the automation component will be created).

dateadd.name: DateAdd
dateadd.doc: Adds time (in seconds) to a time/date value.

dateday.name: DateDay
dateday.doc: Gets the day of the month from a time/date variable.

dateinfo.name: DateInfo
dateinfo.doc: Returns the date format currently used on the Plant SCADA Server.

datemonth.name: DateMonth
datemonth.doc: Gets the month from a time/date variable.

datesub.name: DateSub
datesub.doc: Subtracts time (in seconds) from a time/date value.

dateweekday.name: DateWeekDay
dateweekday.doc: Gets the day of the week from a time/date variable.

dateyear.name: DateYear
dateyear.doc: Gets the year from a time/date variable.

date.name: Date
date.doc: Gets the current date in string format.

ddeexec.name: DDEExec
ddeexec.doc: Executes a command in an external Windows application running on the same computer. With this function, you can control other applications that support DDE.

ddehexecute.name: DDEhExecute
ddehexecute.doc: Executes a command in an external Windows application. You need to first start a conversation with the DDEhInitiate function, and use the handle returned by that function to identify the conversation.

ddehgetlasterror.name: DDEhGetLastError
ddehgetlasterror.doc: Gets the latest error code issued from Windows for the conversation identified by the handle.

ddehinitiate.name: DDEhInitiate
ddehinitiate.doc: Starts a conversation with an external Windows application. When the data exchange is complete, you should terminate the conversation to free system resources.

ddehpoke.name: DDEhPoke
ddehpoke.doc: Writes a value to an external Windows application, for example, an Excel spreadsheet. The value is written once to the application. (To write the value dynamically, you need to call this function at the rate at which the data needs to be updated.)

ddehreadln.name: DDEhReadLn
ddehreadln.doc: Reads a line of text from a DDE Conversion, for example, from an Excel spreadsheet. You need to first start a conversation with the DDEhInitiate function, and use the handle returned by that function to identify the conversation.

ddehrequest.name: DDEhRequest
ddehrequest.doc: Reads a value from an external Windows application, for example, from an Excel spreadsheet. You need to first start a conversation with the DDEhInitiate function, and use the handle returned by that function to identify the conversation.

ddehsetmode.name: DDEhSetMode
ddehsetmode.doc: Set the mode of the DDE conversation. The default mode of a DDE conversation is to use TEXT data format - a simple string of data.

ddehterminate.name: DDEhTerminate
ddehterminate.doc: Closes the conversation identified by the handle, and frees the resources associated with that conversation. After you call this function, the handle is no longer valid.

ddehwriteln.name: DDEhWriteLn
ddehwriteln.doc: Writes a line of text to the DDE conversation. With this function, you can write any amount of text to the DDE conversation.

ddepost.name: DDEPost
ddepost.doc: Makes a Plant SCADA variable value available for DDE linking (that is posts a DDE link so that it can be read by other DDE compliant applications running on the same computer).

dderead.name: DDERead
dderead.doc: Reads values from an external DDE compliant Windows application running on the same computer, (for example, from an Excel spreadsheet cell or a Word document).

ddewrite.name: DDEWrite
ddewrite.doc: Writes a value to an external Windows application, for example, to an Excel spreadsheet.

debugbreak.name: DebugBreak
debugbreak.doc: Causes a breakpoint exception error to occur (error number 342). This allows programmers to trap invalid states in their Cicode.

debugmsg.name: DebugMsg
debugmsg.doc: Provides in-line debug messages of user Cicode, to the Kernel, Debugger Debug window, and the SysLog.DAT file. This function can be enabled or disabled with the [Code]DebugMessage parameter or DebugMsgSet() function at runtime.

debugmsgset.name: DebugMsgSet
debugmsgset.doc: Enables/disables the DebugMsg() logging functionality. It also controls whether logging is enabled for the Assert() function. This function also sets the [Code]DebugMessage parameter appropriately.

degtorad.name: DegToRad
degtorad.doc: Converts an angle from degrees to radians.

delayshutdown.name: DelayShutdown
delayshutdown.doc: Terminates 's operation after the specified delay period (in milliseconds). This function is suitable to be called by the CTAPI.

devappend.name: DevAppend
devappend.doc: Appends a blank record to the end of a device. After the record is appended, you can use the DevSetField() function to add data to fields in the record.

devclose.name: DevClose
devclose.doc: Closes a device. Any data in the buffer is flushed to the device before it is closed.

devcontrol.name: DevControl
devcontrol.doc: Controls a dBASE or SQL device. You can pack a dBASE device to physically remove deleted records, or re-index a dBASE device to regenerate the keys.

devcurr.name: DevCurr
devcurr.doc: Gets the current device handle. You can only call this function in a report, to get the handle of the device where the report is logging. You can then use the other device functions (for example, DevPrint()) to access that logging device.

devdelete.name: DevDelete
devdelete.doc: Deletes the current record in a dBASE database device. The record is not physically deleted, but is marked for deletion.

devdisable.name: DevDisable
devdisable.doc: Disables (and re-enables) a device from all access, and discards any data written to the device. When a device is disabled, it cannot be opened, and data cannot be read from the device. Use this function to disable logging to a database or printer.

deveof.name: DevEOF
deveof.doc: Gets the status of the end of file (EOF) flag for a device. When you use the DevPrev(), DevNext(), or DevSeek() function, the start or end of the device will eventually be reached, and the EOF flag will be set. Use this function to test the EOF flag.

devfind.name: DevFind
devfind.doc: Searches a device for a record that contains specified data in a specified field. The search starts at the current record and continues forward until the matched data is found or the end of the database is reached.

devfirst.name: DevFirst
devfirst.doc: Finds the first record in a device.

devflush.name: DevFlush
devflush.doc: Flushes buffered data to the physical device.

devgetfield.name: DevGetField
devgetfield.doc: Gets field data from the current record in a device.

devhistory.name: DevHistory
devhistory.doc: Renames a device file and any subsequent history files. The current device is closed and renamed as the first history file.

devmodify.name: DevModify
devmodify.doc: Modifies the attributes of a device. The device needs to be closed before you can modify a device.

devnext.name: DevNext
devnext.doc: Gets the next record in a device.

devopen.name: DevOpen
devopen.doc: Opens a device and returns the device handle.

devprev.name: DevPrev
devprev.doc: Gets the previous record in a device.

devprint.name: DevPrint
devprint.doc: Prints free-format data to groups of devices.

devreadln.name: DevReadLn
devreadln.doc: Reads data from the current record of a device until the end of the line, or end of the record. If the device is record-based, the record number is incremented.

devrecno.name: DevRecNo
devrecno.doc: Gets the current record number of a device.

devseek.name: DevSeek
devseek.doc: Moves the device pointer to a specified position in the device.

devsetfield.name: DevSetField
devsetfield.doc: Sets new field data in the current record in a device.

devsize.name: DevSize
devsize.doc: Gets the size of a physical device.

devwrite.name: DevWrite
devwrite.doc: Writes a string to a device. If the device is free-format, the data is written to the device as specified.

devwriteln.name: DevWriteLn
devwriteln.doc: Writes a string to a device. If the device is free-format, the data is written to the device, followed by a newline character.

devzap.name: DevZap
devzap.doc: Zaps a device. If a database device is zapped, all records are deleted. If an ASCII file is zapped, the file is truncated to 0 (zero) length.

displayruntimemanager.name: DisplayRuntimeManager
displayruntimemanager.doc: This function will start Runtime Manager if it is not already running, otherwise it will just bring the Runtime Manager to the foreground.

dllcall.name: DLLCall
dllcall.doc: Calls a DLL function, and passes a string of arguments to that function.

dllcallex.name: DLLCallEx
dllcallex.doc: Calls a DLL function, and passes the specified arguments to that function.

dllclasscallmethod.name: DllClassCallMethod
dllclasscallmethod.doc: Use this function to call a method of a .Net object, passing in the method name and any arguments required for the matching prototype of the method.

dllclasscreate.name: DllClassCreate
dllclasscreate.doc: Use this function to instantiate a new .Net object by specifying the path, class and arguments required for the matching constructor of the class.

dllclassdispose.name: DllClassDispose
dllclassdispose.doc: Use this function to clean up resources used by the .Net object and any other objects created via the use of the object.

dllclassgetproperty.name: DllClassGetProperty
dllclassgetproperty.doc: Use this function to get a property of the .Net object.

dllclassisvalid.name: DllClassIsValid
dllclassisvalid.doc: Use this function to validate the handle for the class returned from DllClassCreate.

dllclasssetproperty.name: DllClassSetProperty
dllclasssetproperty.doc: Use this function to set a property of the .Net object. The property may be of any type or an object itself.

dllclose.name: DLLClose
dllclose.doc: Closes the link to a DLL function, and frees the memory allocated for that function link.

dllopen.name: DLLOpen
dllopen.doc: Opens a link to a DLL function, by loading the specified DLL library into memory and attaching it to the named function.

driverinfo.name: DriverInfo
driverinfo.doc: Provides information about the driver for a specified I/O device.

dspancreatecontrolobject.name: DspAnCreateControlObject
dspancreatecontrolobject.doc: Creates a new instance of an ActiveX object.

dspanfree.name: DspAnFree
dspanfree.doc: Frees (removes) an AN from the current page. If an animation exists at the animation number, it is deleted before the AN is freed. Use this function to free existing ANs or ANs created with the DspAnNew() function.

dspangetarea.name: DspAnGetArea
dspangetarea.doc: Gets the area configured for an object at a specific AN (animation-point number). The area is returned as an integer.

dspangetmetadata.name: DspAnGetMetadata
dspangetmetadata.doc: Retrieves the field value of the specified metadata entry.

dspangetmetadataat.name: DspAnGetMetadataAt
dspangetmetadataat.doc: Retrieves metadata information at the specified index.

dspangetpos.name: DspAnGetPos
dspangetpos.doc: Gets the x and y coordinates of an AN, in pixels, relative to the top-left corner of the window.

dspangetprivilege.name: DspAnGetPrivilege
dspangetprivilege.doc: Gets the privileges configured for an object at a specific AN (animation-point number).

dspaninfo.name: DspAnInfo
dspaninfo.doc: Gets information on an AN - the type or state of the animation that is currently displayed.

dspaninrgn.name: DspAnInRgn
dspaninrgn.doc: Checks if an AN is within a region bounded by two ANs.

dspanmove.name: DspAnMove
dspanmove.doc: Moves an AN to a new position. Any animation at this AN is also moved.

dspanmoverel.name: DspAnMoveRel
dspanmoverel.doc: Moves an AN relative to its current position. Any animation at this AN is also moved.

dspannew.name: DspAnNew
dspannew.doc: Creates an AN at the specified x and y coordinates.

dspannewrel.name: DspAnNewRel
dspannewrel.doc: This function is only used for V3.xx and V4.xx animations, and was superseded by future releases.

dspansetmetadata.name: DspAnSetMetadata
dspansetmetadata.doc: Non-blocking function that sets the value of the specified metadata entry.

dspansetmetadataat.name: DspAnSetMetadataAt
dspansetmetadataat.doc: Non-blocking function, that sets the value of a metadata entry.

dspansetname.name: DspAnSetName
dspansetname.doc: Using a valid AN set the name of an animation object.

dsparraybyan.name: DspArrayByAn
dsparraybyan.doc: Calculates the absolute (positive) value of a number.

dspbar.name: DspBar
dspbar.doc: Displays a bar graph (on a graphics page) at a specified AN.

dspbmp.name: DspBmp
dspbmp.doc: Displays a bitmap at a specified AN. This function allows you to display any bitmap file at run time.

dspbutton.name: DspButton
dspbutton.doc: Displays a button at a specified AN. When the button is selected, the key definition is put into the key command line.

dspbuttonfn.name: DspButtonFn
dspbuttonfn.doc: Displays a button at a specified AN. When the button is selected, a user function is called. If the width and height are 0 (zero), then the button adjusts to the size of the button sName.

dspchart.name: DspChart
dspchart.doc: Displays a chart at an AN. Charts are trend lines with markers on them.

dspclearclip.name: DspClearClip
dspclearclip.doc: Sets tool tip text associated with an AN. Any existing text associated with the AN will be replaced with the new text.

dspcol.name: DspCol
dspcol.doc: DspCol is deprecated in this version of Plant SCADA

dspdel.name: DspDel
dspdel.doc: Deletes all objects from a specified AN.

dspdelayrenderbegin.name: DspDelayRenderBegin
dspdelayrenderbegin.doc: Delays screen updating until DspDelayRenderEnd is called. This function should be used with DspDelayRenderEnd() to "sandwich" Cicode that will modify the appearance of a page.

dspdelayrenderend.name: DspDelayRenderEnd
dspdelayrenderend.doc: Ends the screen update delay set by DspDelayRenderBegin. This function should be used with DspDelayRenderBegin() to "sandwich" Cicode that will modify the appearance of a page.

dspdirty.name: DspDirty
dspdirty.doc: Forces Plant SCADA to update an AN. Normally, Plant SCADA updates the animation on the AN only if the data has changed.

dsperror.name: DspError
dsperror.doc: Displays an error message at the prompt AN on the operator's computer.

dspfile.name: DspFile
dspfile.doc: Defines the screen attributes for displaying a text file. This function defines a "window" where the file will be displayed.

dspfilegetinfo.name: DspFileGetInfo
dspfilegetinfo.doc: Gets the attributes of a file-to-screen display (used for displaying text files).

dspfilegetname.name: DspFileGetName
dspfilegetname.doc: Gets the name of the file being displayed in the display "window".

dspfilescroll.name: DspFileScroll
dspfilescroll.doc: Scrolls a file (displayed in the display "window") by a number of characters.

dspfilesetname.name: DspFileSetName
dspfilesetname.doc: Sets the name of the file to display in the display "window".

dspfont.name: DspFont
dspfont.doc: Creates a font and returns a font handle.

dspfonthnd.name: DspFontHnd
dspfonthnd.doc: Gets the font handle of a font that is defined in the Fonts database.

dspfullscreen.name: DspFullScreen
dspfullscreen.doc: Disables or enables the fullscreen mode of the currently active window.

dspgetanbottom.name: DspGetAnBottom
dspgetanbottom.doc: Gets the bottom extent of the object at the specified AN.

dspgetancur.name: DspGetAnCur
dspgetancur.doc: Gets the AN of the current graphics object.

dspgetanextent.name: DspGetAnExtent
dspgetanextent.doc: Gets the extent of the object (the enclosing boundary) at the specified AN.

dspgetanfirst.name: DspGetAnFirst
dspgetanfirst.doc: Gets the first AN on the current page, based on the order in which the ANs were stored by Graphics Builder.

dspgetanfromname.name: DspGetAnFromName
dspgetanfromname.doc: Name used to retrieve the AN of an object on the page.

dspgetanfromnamerelative.name: DspGetAnFromNameRelative
dspgetanfromnamerelative.doc: Name used to retrieve the AN of an object on the page.

dspgetanfrompoint.name: DspGetAnFromPoint
dspgetanfrompoint.doc: Gets the AN of the object at a specified set of screen coordinates.

dspgetanheight.name: DspGetAnHeight
dspgetanheight.doc: Gets the height of the object at a specified AN.

dspgetanleft.name: DspGetAnLeft
dspgetanleft.doc: Gets the left extent of the object at the specified AN.

dspgetannext.name: DspGetAnNext
dspgetannext.doc: Returns the AN that follows the specified AN, based on the order in which the ANs were stored on a page by Graphics Builder.

dspgetanright.name: DspGetAnRight
dspgetanright.doc: Gets the right extent of the object at the specified AN.

dspgetantop.name: DspGetAnTop
dspgetantop.doc: Gets the top extent of the object at the specified AN.

dspgetanwidth.name: DspGetAnWidth
dspgetanwidth.doc: Gets the width of the object at a specified AN.

dspgetmetadatafromname.name: DspGetMetadataFromName
dspgetmetadatafromname.doc: Name used to retrieve the metadata of an object on the page.

dspgetmetadatafromnamerelative.name: DspGetMetadataFromNameRelative
dspgetmetadatafromnamerelative.doc: Name used to retrieve the metadata of an object on the page relative to a given AN.

dspgetmouse.name: DspGetMouse
dspgetmouse.doc: Gets the x and y coordinates of the mouse position, relative to the top left corner of the window.

dspgetmouseover.name: DspGetMouseOver
dspgetmouseover.doc: Determines if the mouse is within the boundaries of a given AN.

dspgetnamefroman.name: DspGetNameFromAn
dspgetnamefroman.doc: Using a valid AN the animation name of the object is returned.

dspgetnearestan.name: DspGetNearestAn
dspgetnearestan.doc: Gets the AN nearest to a specified x,y pixel location.

dspgetparentan.name: DspGetParentAn
dspgetparentan.doc: Gets the parent animation number (if any), for the specified animation number. AN animation point will have a parent animation point if it corresponds to an object in a group.

dspgetslider.name: DspGetSlider
dspgetslider.doc: Gets the current position (value) of a slider at an AN. You can call this function in the slider event to find the new position of the slider.

dspgettip.name: DspGetTip
dspgettip.doc: Gets the tool tip text associated with an AN.

dspgraybutton.name: DspGrayButton
dspgraybutton.doc: Grays and disables a button. If the button is a symbol, the symbol is overwritten with a gray mask.

dspinfo.name: DspInfo
dspinfo.doc: Extracts individual pieces of object information from an AN.

dspinfodestroy.name: DspInfoDestroy
dspinfodestroy.doc: Destroys an object information block created by DspInfoNew(). You should destroy an object information block when you no longer need it.

dspinfofield.name: DspInfoField
dspinfofield.doc: Obtains static and real-time data from a variable tag. You get static data from the Variable Tags database.

dspinfonew.name: DspInfoNew
dspinfonew.doc: Creates an object information block. Use this function with the associated low-level animation information functions to get and process object information on an AN.

dspinfovalid.name: DspInfoValid
dspinfovalid.doc: Checks if an object information block handle is valid. An object information block handle becomes invalid after it is destroyed, or if the user closes the page it is associated with.

dspisbuttongray.name: DspIsButtonGray
dspisbuttongray.doc: Gets the current status of a button.

dspkernel.name: DspKernel
dspkernel.doc: Displays the Kernel window and prompts the user to login as the 'kernel' user.

dspmarkermove.name: DspMarkerMove
dspmarkermove.doc: Moves a trend or chart marker to a specified position.

dspmarkernew.name: DspMarkerNew
dspmarkernew.doc: Creates a new trend marker. A trend marker is used to show cursor values or limits on a trend. You can use up to 10 markers on a single trend or chart.

dspmci.name: DspMCI
dspmci.doc: Controls a multimedia device using MCI. The Media Control Interface (MCI) is a high-level command interface to multimedia devices and resource files.

dsppopupconfigmenu.name: DspPopupConfigMenu
dsppopupconfigmenu.doc: Displays the contents of a menu node as a pop-up (context) menu, and run the command associated with the selected menu item.

dsppopupmenu.name: DspPopupMenu
dsppopupmenu.doc: Creates a popup menu consisting of a number of menu items.

dsprichtext.name: DspRichText
dsprichtext.doc: Creates a Rich Text object of the given dimensions at the animation point nAN.

dsprichtextedit.name: DspRichTextEdit
dsprichtextedit.doc: Enables editing of the contents of the rich text object at nAN if nEdit = TRUE, and disables editing if nEdit = FALSE.

dsprichtextenable.name: DspRichTextEnable
dsprichtextenable.doc: Enables the rich text object at nAN if nEnable = TRUE, and disables the object if nEnable = FALSE. When the object is disabled, its contents cannot be selected or copied etc.

dsprichtextgetinfo.name: DspRichTextGetInfo
dsprichtextgetinfo.doc: Retrieves size information about the rich text object at animation point nAN.

dsprichtextload.name: DspRichTextLoad
dsprichtextload.doc: Loads a copy of the file Filename into the rich text object) at animation point nAN.

dsprichtextpgscroll.name: DspRichTextPgScroll
dsprichtextpgscroll.doc: Scrolls the contents of the rich text object displayed at nAN, by one page length in the direction given in direction.

dsprichtextprint.name: DspRichTextPrint
dsprichtextprint.doc: Prints the contents of the rich text object at animation point nAN, to the port PortName.

dsprichtextsave.name: DspRichTextSave
dsprichtextsave.doc: Saves the contents of the rich text object at animation point nAN, to the file Filename.

dsprichtextscroll.name: DspRichTextScroll
dsprichtextscroll.doc: Scrolls the contents of the rich text object displayed at nAN.

dsprubend.name: DspRubEnd
dsprubend.doc: Ends the rubber band selection, and returns the coordinates of the rubber band selection.

dsprubmove.name: DspRubMove
dsprubmove.doc: Moves the rubber band selection to the new position. You need to first have defined a rubber band selection using the DspRubStart() and DspRubEnd() functions.

dsprubsetclip.name: DspRubSetClip
dsprubsetclip.doc: Sets the clipping region for the rubber band display. If you enable the clipping region, the rubber band will not move outside of the clip region.

dsprubstart.name: DspRubStart
dsprubstart.doc: Starts the rubber band selection. Call this function when the left mouse button is pressed - the rubber band is displayed at the starting position.

dspsetclip.name: DspSetClip
dspsetclip.doc: Sets the clip rectangle for an AN, defined by the top, left, right and bottom.

dspsetcurcolor.name: DspSetCurColor
dspsetcurcolor.doc: Sets tool tip text associated with an AN. Any existing text associated with the AN will be replaced with the new text.

dspsetmetadatafromname.name: DspSetMetadataFromName
dspsetmetadatafromname.doc: Name used to set the metadata of an object on the page.

dspsetmetadatafromnamerelative.name: DspSetMetadataFromNameRelative
dspsetmetadatafromnamerelative.doc: Name used to set the metadata of an object on the page.

dspsetslider.name: DspSetSlider
dspsetslider.doc: Sets the current position of a slider at the specified AN. You can use this function to move a slider, and adjust the value of the variable associated with the slider.

dspsettip.name: DspSetTip
dspsettip.doc: Sets tool tip text associated with an AN. Any existing text associated with the AN will be replaced with the new text.

dspsettooltipfont.name: DspSetTooltipFont
dspsettooltipfont.doc: Sets the font for tool tip text.

dspstatus.name: DspStatus
dspstatus.doc: Determines whether the object at the specified AN will be grayed (hatch pattern) in the event communication attempts are unsuccessful.

dspstr.name: DspStr
dspstr.doc: Displays a string at a specified AN.

dspsym.name: DspSym
dspsym.doc: Displays a symbol or a Genie at a specified AN. This dynamically displayed object  will disappear at page navigation.

dspsymanm.name: DspSymAnm
dspsymanm.doc: Animates a series of symbols at an AN.

dspsymanmex.name: DspSymAnmEx
dspsymanmex.doc: Animates a series of symbols at an AN.

dspsymatsize.name: DspSymAtSize
dspsymatsize.doc: Displays a symbol or a genie at the specified scale and offset from the AN position.

dsptext.name: DspText
dsptext.doc: Displays text at a specified AN location. This function does the same operation as DspStr(), however it uses a font number rather than a font name.

dsptipmode.name: DspTipMode
dsptipmode.doc: Switches the display of tool tips on or off. This function overrides the setting in the [Page]TipHelp parameter.

dsptrend.name: DspTrend
dsptrend.doc: Displays a trend at an AN. Values are plotted on the trend pens.

dsptrendinfo.name: DspTrendInfo
dsptrendinfo.doc: Gets information on a trend definition.

dumpkernel.name: DumpKernel
dumpkernel.doc: Dumps Kernel data to the KERNEL.DAT file.

engtogeneric.name: EngToGeneric
engtogeneric.doc: Gets a variable in the Plant SCADA generic scale format. Plant SCADA uses this scale to display trends.

entercriticalsection.name: EnterCriticalSection
entercriticalsection.doc: Requests permission for the current thread to have access to a critical section (shared critical resource).

equipbrowseclose.name: EquipBrowseClose
equipbrowseclose.doc: The EquipBrowseClose function terminates an active data browse session and cleans up resources associated with the session.

equipbrowsefirst.name: EquipBrowseFirst
equipbrowsefirst.doc: The EquipBrowseFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

equipbrowsegetfield.name: EquipBrowseGetField
equipbrowsegetfield.doc: The EquipBrowseGetField function retrieves the value of the specified field from the record the data browse cursor is currently referencing.

equipbrowsenext.name: EquipBrowseNext
equipbrowsenext.doc: The EquipBrowseNext function moves the data browse cursor forward one record.

equipbrowsenumrecords.name: EquipBrowseNumRecords
equipbrowsenumrecords.doc: The EquipBrowseNumRecords function returns the number of records that match the filter criteria.

equipbrowseopen.name: EquipBrowseOpen
equipbrowseopen.doc: The EquipBrowseOpen function initiates a new browse session and returns a handle to the new session that can be used in subsequent data browse function calls.

equipbrowseprev.name: EquipBrowsePrev
equipbrowseprev.doc: The EquipBrowsePrev function moves the data browse cursor back one record.

equipcheckupdate.name: EquipCheckUpdate
equipcheckupdate.doc: The EquipCheckUpdate function checks if the equipment database file has been updated, and provides the facility to reload it.

equipgetproperty.name: EquipGetProperty
equipgetproperty.doc: This function reads a property of an equipment database record from the EQUIP.RDB database file.

equiprefbrowseclose.name: EquipRefBrowseClose
equiprefbrowseclose.doc: The EquipRefBrowseClose function terminates an active data browse session and cleans up resources associated with the session.

equiprefbrowsefirst.name: EquipRefBrowseFirst
equiprefbrowsefirst.doc: The EquipRefBrowseFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

equiprefbrowsenext.name: EquipRefBrowseNext
equiprefbrowsenext.doc: The EquipRefBrowseNext function moves the data browse cursor forward one record.

equiprefbrowsenumrecords.name: EquipRefBrowseNumRecords
equiprefbrowsenumrecords.doc: The EquipRefBrowseNumRecords function returns the number of records that match the filter criteria.

equiprefbrowseopen.name: EquipRefBrowseOpen
equiprefbrowseopen.doc: The EquipRefBrowseOpen function initiates a new browse session and returns a handle to the new session that can be used in subsequent reference browse function calls.

equiprefbrowseprev.name: EquipRefBrowsePrev
equiprefbrowseprev.doc: The EquipRefBrowsePrev function moves the data browse cursor back one record.

equipsetproperty.name: EquipSetProperty
equipsetproperty.doc: The EquipSetProperty function sets the property of an item of equipment.

equipstatebrowseclose.name: EquipStateBrowseClose
equipstatebrowseclose.doc: The EquipStateBrowseClose function terminates a browsing session and cleans up the resources used by the session.

equipstatebrowsefirst.name: EquipStateBrowseFirst
equipstatebrowsefirst.doc: The EquipStateBrowseFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

equipstatebrowsegetfield.name: EquipStateBrowseGetField
equipstatebrowsegetfield.doc: The EquipStateBrowseGetField function returns the value of the particular field in a record to which the data browse cursor is currently referencing.

equipstatebrowsenext.name: EquipStateBrowseNext
equipstatebrowsenext.doc: The EquipStateBrowseNext function places the data browse cursor at the next available record.

equipstatebrowsenumrecords.name: EquipStateBrowseNumRecords
equipstatebrowsenumrecords.doc: The EquipStateBrowseNumRecords function returns the number of records that match the current filter criteria.

equipstatebrowseopen.name: EquipStateBrowseOpen
equipstatebrowseopen.doc: The EquipStateBrowseOpen function initiates a new session for browsing the equipment states configured. It returns a handle for the browsing session which can be used for further browsing operations.

equipstatebrowseprev.name: EquipStateBrowsePrev
equipstatebrowseprev.doc: The EquipStateBrowsePrev function places the data browse cursor at the previous record.

errcom.name: ErrCom
errcom.doc: Gets the communication status for the current Cicode task.

errdrv.name: ErrDrv
errdrv.doc: Gets a protocol-specific error message and native error code.

errgethw.name: ErrGetHw
errgethw.doc: Gets the current hardware error status for an I/O device.

errhelp.name: ErrHelp
errhelp.doc: Displays information about a hardware error.

errinfo.name: ErrInfo
errinfo.doc: Gets extended error information on the last error that was detected.

errlog.name: ErrLog
errlog.doc: Logs a message to the system log file.

errmsg.name: ErrMsg
errmsg.doc: Gets the error message associated with a detected hardware error.

errsethw.name: ErrSetHw
errsethw.doc: Sets the hardware error status for a hardware device.

errsetlevel.name: ErrSetLevel
errsetlevel.doc: Sets the nesting error level to enable error checking inside a nested function (when error checking has been disabled).

exec.name: Exec
exec.doc: Executes an application or PIF file.

executedtspkg.name: ExecuteDTSPkg
executedtspkg.doc: Loads and executes a DTS (Data Transformation Services) package which initiates data transfer and transformations between OLE DB data sources.

exp.name: Exp
exp.doc: Calculates the exponential of a number (natural logarithm base e).

fact.name: Fact
fact.doc: Calculates the factorial of a number.

fileeof.name: FileEOF
fileeof.doc: Determines if the end of the file has been reached.

filefind.name: FileFind
filefind.doc: Finds a file that matches a specified search criteria.

filefindclose.name: FileFindClose
filefindclose.doc: Closes a find (started with FileFind) that did not run to completion.

filegettime.name: FileGetTime
filegettime.doc: Gets the time on a file.

filemakepath.name: FileMakePath
filemakepath.doc: Creates a file path string from individual components.

fileopen.name: FileOpen
fileopen.doc: Opens a file and returns a file number that can be used by other file functions.

fileprint.name: FilePrint
fileprint.doc: Prints a file on a device.

fileread.name: FileRead
fileread.doc: Reads a number of characters from a file.

filereadblock.name: FileReadBlock
filereadblock.doc: Reads a number of characters from a file.

filereadln.name: FileReadLn
filereadln.doc: Reads a line from a file.

filerichtextprint.name: FileRichTextPrint
filerichtextprint.doc: Prints the rich text file sFilename to the printer given by sPortname.

fileseek.name: FileSeek
fileseek.doc: Moves the file pointer to a specified position in a file.

filesettime.name: FileSetTime
filesettime.doc: Sets the time on a file.

filesize.name: FileSize
filesize.doc: Gets the size of a file.

filesplitpath.name: FileSplitPath
filesplitpath.doc: Splits a file path into individual string components.

filewrite.name: FileWrite
filewrite.doc: Writes a string to a file. The string is written at the current file position.

filewriteblock.name: FileWriteBlock
filewriteblock.doc: Writes a string or buffer to a file.

filewriteln.name: FileWriteLn
filewriteln.doc: Writes a string to a file, followed by a newline character.

fmtfieldhnd.name: FmtFieldHnd
fmtfieldhnd.doc: Gets the handle of a field in a format template.

fmtgetfield.name: FmtGetField
fmtgetfield.doc: Gets field data from a format template.

fmtgetfieldcount.name: FmtGetFieldCount
fmtgetfieldcount.doc: Retrieves the number of fields in a format object.

fmtgetfieldhnd.name: FmtGetFieldHnd
fmtgetfieldhnd.doc: Gets field data from a format template.

fmtgetfieldname.name: FmtGetFieldName
fmtgetfieldname.doc: Retrieves the name of a particular field in a format object.

fmtgetfieldwidth.name: FmtGetFieldWidth
fmtgetfieldwidth.doc: Retrieves the width of a particular field in a format object.

fmtopen.name: FmtOpen
fmtopen.doc: Creates a format template. After you create a template, you can use it for formatting data into strings or extracting data from a string.

fmtsetfield.name: FmtSetField
fmtsetfield.doc: Sets data in a field of a format template.

fmtsetfieldhnd.name: FmtSetFieldHnd
fmtsetfieldhnd.doc: The fields you can build the formatted string with the FmtToStr() function.

fmttostr.name: FmtToStr
fmttostr.doc: Builds a formatted string from the current field data (in a format template).

formactive.name: FormActive
formactive.doc: Checks if a form is currently active (displayed on the screen).

formaddlist.name: FormAddList
formaddlist.doc: Adds a text string to a list box or combo box.

formbutton.name: FormButton
formbutton.doc: Adds a button to the current form.

formcheckbox.name: FormCheckBox
formcheckbox.doc: Adds a check box to the current form.

formcombobox.name: FormComboBox
formcombobox.doc: Adds a combo box to the current form.

formcurr.name: FormCurr
formcurr.doc: Gets the form and field handles for the current form and field. You should call this function only from within a callback function. You can then use the same callback function for all forms and fields, regardless of how the boxes, buttons, etc. on the forms are used. You should use this function with the FormGetInst() function.

formdestroy.name: FormDestroy
formdestroy.doc: Destroys a form that is removes it from the screen.

formedit.name: FormEdit
formedit.doc: Adds an edit field to the current form. You should call this function only after the FormNew() function and before the FormRead() function. A user input/edit box is added to the form at the specified column and row position. The operator can enter or edit the text in the edit box. This text is then passed to this function as Text.

formfield.name: FormField
formfield.doc: Adds a field control device (such as a button, check box, or edit field) to the current form.

formgetcurrinst.name: FormGetCurrInst
formgetcurrinst.doc: Extracts data associated with a field (set by the FormSetInst() function). You should call this function only from within a field callback function. This function is the same as calling the FormCurr() function and then the FormGetInst() function.

formgetdata.name: FormGetData
formgetdata.doc: Gets all data associated with a form and puts it into the output string buffers.

formgetinst.name: FormGetInst
formgetinst.doc: Extracts the data associated with a field (set by the FormSetInst() function). You would normally use this function in a field callback function. It allows single callback functions to know that the form and field are associated.

formgettext.name: FormGetText
formgettext.doc: Gets the current text from a form field.

formgoto.name: FormGoto
formgoto.doc: Goes to a specified form. The form is displayed on top of all windows and the keyboard focus is set to this form.

formgroupbox.name: FormGroupBox
formgroupbox.doc: Adds a group box to the current form.

forminput.name: FormInput
forminput.doc: Adds a prompt and edit field to the current form. You should call this function only after the FormNew() function and before the FormRead() function. When FormRead() is called, the form will display with the prompt and edit box. The operator's input is passed back as a string (Text).

formlistaddtext.name: FormListAddText
formlistaddtext.doc: Adds a new text entry to a combo box or a list box while the form is displayed.

formlistbox.name: FormListBox
formlistbox.doc: Adds a list box to the current form.

formlistdeletetext.name: FormListDeleteText
formlistdeletetext.doc: Deletes an existing text entry from a combo box or a list box while the form is displayed.

formlistselecttext.name: FormListSelectText
formlistselecttext.doc: Selects (highlights) a text entry in a Combo box or a List box while the form is displayed.

formnew.name: FormNew
formnew.doc: Creates a new data entry form and defines its size and mode.

formnumpad.name: FormNumPad
formnumpad.doc: Provides a keypad form for the operator to add numeric values.

formopenfile.name: FormOpenFile
formopenfile.doc: Displays a File Open dialog box.

formpassword.name: FormPassword
formpassword.doc: Adds both a password prompt and edit field to the current form. You should call this function only after the FormNew() function and before the FormRead() function. When FormRead() is called, the form will also display the password prompt and edit field.

formposition.name: FormPosition
formposition.doc: Sets the position of a form on the screen, before it is displayed.

formprompt.name: FormPrompt
formprompt.doc: Adds a prompt field to the current form.

formradiobutton.name: FormRadioButton
formradiobutton.doc: Adds a radio button to the current form, allowing the operator to make a selection from a multiple choice list.

formread.name: FormRead
formread.doc: Displays the current form (created with the FormNew() function), with all the fields that were added (with the form field functions).

formsaveasfile.name: FormSaveAsFile
formsaveasfile.doc: Displays a File Save As dialog box.

formsecurepassword.name: FormSecurePassword
formsecurepassword.doc: Adds both a password prompt and edit field to the current form.

formselectprinter.name: FormSelectPrinter
formselectprinter.doc: Displays the Select Printer dialog box.

formsetdata.name: FormSetData
formsetdata.doc: Sets all the edit data from the string buffers into the form.

formsetinst.name: FormSetInst
formsetinst.doc: Associates an integer and string value with each field on a form.

formsettext.name: FormSetText

formwndhnd.name: FormWndHnd
formwndhnd.doc: Gets the window handle for the given form.

ftpfilecopy.name: FTPFileCopy

ftpfilefind.name: FTPFileFind
ftpfilefind.doc: Finds a file on the FTP server that matches a specified search criteria.

ftpfilefindclose.name: FTPFileFindClose
ftpfilefindclose.doc: Closes a find (started with FTPFileFind) that did not run to completion.

fullname.name: FullName
fullname.doc: Gets the full name of the user who is currently logged on to the system. The user can be a Plant SCADA or a Windows user.

fuzzyclose.name: FuzzyClose
fuzzyclose.doc: Frees all memory and information for the specified instance.

fuzzygetcodevalue.name: FuzzyGetCodeValue
fuzzygetcodevalue.doc: Gets a value for the specified input of the specified instance.

fuzzygetshellvalue.name: FuzzyGetShellValue
fuzzygetshellvalue.doc: Gets a value for the specified input of the specified instance.

fuzzyopen.name: FuzzyOpen
fuzzyopen.doc: This function loads a *.FTR file, allocates memory and creates a handle for this fuzzy instance.

fuzzysetcodevalue.name: FuzzySetCodeValue
fuzzysetcodevalue.doc: Sets a value for the specified input of the specified instance.

fuzzysetshellvalue.name: FuzzySetShellValue
fuzzysetshellvalue.doc: Sets a value for the specified input of the specified instance.

fuzzytrace.name: FuzzyTrace
fuzzytrace.doc: Controls the trace process (starting and stopping) of the specified instance.

getbluevalue.name: GetBlueValue
getbluevalue.doc: Returns the Blue component of a packed RGB color.

getevent.name: GetEvent
getevent.doc: Gets the function handle of the existing callback event handler.

getgreenvalue.name: GetGreenValue
getgreenvalue.doc: Returns the green component of a packed RGB color.

getlanguage.name: GetLanguage
getlanguage.doc: Gets the language currently used on the display client.

getlogging.name: GetLogging
getlogging.doc: Gets the current value for logging parameters.

getpriv.name: GetPriv
getpriv.doc: Checks if the current user has a privilege for a specified area.

getredvalue.name: GetRedValue
getredvalue.doc: Returns the red component of a packed RGB color.

getwintitle.name: GetWinTitle
getwintitle.doc: Returns the name of the active window as a string.

grpdelete.name: GrpDelete
grpdelete.doc: Deletes a single element or all elements from a group.

grpfirst.name: GrpFirst
grpfirst.doc: Gets the value of the first element in a group.

grpin.name: GrpIn
grpin.doc: Determines if an element is in a group.

grpinsert.name: GrpInsert
grpinsert.doc: Adds an element (or another group) to a group.

grpmath.name: GrpMath
grpmath.doc: Performs mathematical operations on two groups, and stores the result in another group.

grpname.name: GrpName
grpname.doc: Gets the name of a group from a group handle.

grpnext.name: GrpNext
grpnext.doc: Gets the value of the next element in a group.

grpopen.name: GrpOpen
grpopen.doc: Creates a group and returns a group handle, or gets the group handle of an existing group.

grptostr.name: GrpToStr
grptostr.doc: Converts a group into a string of values separated by " , " and " .. ". You can then display the group on the screen or in a report.

halt.name: Halt
halt.doc: Stops the execution of the current Cicode task and returns to Plant SCADA.

hextostr.name: HexToStr
hextostr.doc: Converts a number into a hexadecimal string.

highbyte.name: HighByte
highbyte.doc: Gets the high-order byte of a two-byte integer.

highword.name: HighWord
highword.doc: Gets the high-order word of a four-byte integer.

hwalarmque.name: HwAlarmQue
hwalarmque.doc: Returns the handle of the hardware alarm queue.

infoform.name: InfoForm
infoform.doc: Displays graphics object information for the object under the mouse pointer. If there is no object directly under the mouse pointer, it displays information for the nearest object.

infoforman.name: InfoFormAn
infoforman.doc: Displays graphics object information for a specified AN.

input.name: Input
input.doc: Displays a dialog box in which an operator can input a single value.

inttoreal.name: IntToReal
inttoreal.doc: Converts an integer into a real (floating point) number.

inttostr.name: IntToStr
inttostr.doc: Converts a number into a string.

iodevicecontrol.name: IODeviceControl
iodevicecontrol.doc: Provides control of individual I/O devices.

iodeviceinfo.name: IODeviceInfo
iodeviceinfo.doc: Gets information about a specified I/O device.

iodevicestats.name: IODeviceStats

iserror.name: IsError

kercmd.name: KerCmd
kercmd.doc: Executes a command in a Kernel window.

kernelqueuelength.name: KernelQueueLength
kernelqueuelength.doc: Obtains the number of records in a queue.

kerneltableinfo.name: KernelTableInfo
kerneltableinfo.doc: Provides a consistent method of accessing items within Kernel Table.

kerneltableitemcount.name: KernelTableItemCount
kerneltableitemcount.doc: Obtains the number of rows in a Kernel Table.

keyallowcursor.name: KeyAllowCursor

keybs.name: KeyBs

keydown.name: KeyDown

keygetcursor.name: KeyGetCursor

keyleft.name: KeyLeft

keymove.name: KeyMove
keymove.doc: Moves the command cursor in a specified direction to the closest AN.

keypeek.name: KeyPeek
