keyput.name: KeyPut
keyput.doc: Puts an ASCII key code or Keyboard key code into the last position of the key command line.

keyputstr.name: KeyPutStr
keyputstr.doc: Puts a string at the end of the key command line. The string can contain either key names or data characters.

keyreplay.name: KeyReplay
keyreplay.doc: Replays the last key sequence (except for the last key, which would execute the command).

keyreplayall.name: KeyReplayAll
keyreplayall.doc: Replays the last key sequence and executes the command.

keyright.name: KeyRight
keyright.doc: Moves the command cursor right (across the page) to the closest AN.

keysetcursor.name: KeySetCursor
keysetcursor.doc: Displays the command cursor at a specified AN.

keysetseq.name: KeySetSeq
keysetseq.doc: Adds a keyboard sequence to the current page at runtime. The key sequence is only added to the current window.

keyup.name: KeyUp
keyup.doc: Moves the command cursor up the page to the closest AN.

languagefiletranslate.name: LanguageFileTranslate
languagefiletranslate.doc: Translates an ASCII file into a local language. Use this function to translate RTF reports for viewing on client screens.

leavecriticalsection.name: LeaveCriticalSection
leavecriticalsection.doc: Relinquishes the current thread's ownership of a critical section (shared critical resource).

libalarmfilterform.name: LibAlarmFilterForm
libalarmfilterform.doc: Displays a generic alarm filter pop-up for specifying filtering criteria for either an alarm list or a named filter.

ln.name: Ln
ln.doc: Calculates the natural (base e) logarithm of a number.

log.name: Log
log.doc: Calculates the base 10 logarithm of a number.

login.name: Login
login.doc: Logs a user into the system using Plant SCADA security and gives users access to the areas and privileges assigned to them in the Users database. Not available when logged in as Windows user.

loginform.name: LoginForm
loginform.doc: Displays a form in which a user can log in to the system by entering their name and password and local language.

logout.name: Logout
logout.doc: Logs the current user out of the Plant SCADA system.

logoutidle.name: LogoutIdle
logoutidle.doc: Sets an idle time for logging out the current user.

lowbyte.name: LowByte
lowbyte.doc: Gets the low-order byte of a two-byte integer.

lowword.name: LowWord
lowword.doc: Gets the low-order word of a four-byte integer.

mailerror.name: MailError
mailerror.doc: Gets the last mail error code. The error code is extracted from the MAPI mail system.

maillogoff.name: MailLogoff
maillogoff.doc: Logs off from the mail system.

maillogon.name: MailLogon
maillogon.doc: Logs on to the mail system.

mailread.name: MailRead
mailread.doc: Reads a standard mail message. The mail message can contain text, an attached file, or both.

mailsend.name: MailSend
mailsend.doc: Sends a standard mail message. The mail message can contain text, an attached file, or both.

makecitectcolour.name: MakeCitectColour
makecitectcolour.doc: Creates a color from red, green and blue component parts.

mapclear.name: MapClear
mapclear.doc: Clear all entries in a map.

mapexists.name: MapExists
mapexists.doc: Checks for the existence of the map.

mapkeycount.name: MapKeyCount
mapkeycount.doc: Retrieves the number of keys in a map.

mapkeydelete.name: MapKeyDelete
mapkeydelete.doc: Use this function to delete a  key and value from a map.

mapkeyexists.name: MapKeyExists
mapkeyexists.doc: Checsk if a key exists in a map.

mapkeyfirst.name: MapKeyFirst
mapkeyfirst.doc: Use this function to retrieve the first property key in a cicode object.

mapkeynext.name: MapKeyNext
mapkeynext.doc: Retrieves the next key after the supplied key in a map.

mapopen.name: MapOpen
mapopen.doc: Creates a new map or to open an existing map.

mapvalueget.name: MapValueGet
mapvalueget.doc: Gets the value from a key in a map.

mapvalueset.name: MapValueSet
mapvalueset.doc: Sets a value of a map key.

mapvaluesetquality.name: MapValueSetQuality
mapvaluesetquality.doc: Sets the quality of a property in a cicode object.

max.name: Max
max.doc: Gets the higher of two numbers.

menugetchild.name: MenuGetChild
menugetchild.doc: Returns the handle to the child node with the specified name.

menugetfirstchild.name: MenuGetFirstChild
menugetfirstchild.doc: Returns the handle to the first child of a menu node.

menugetgenericnode.name: MenuGetGenericNode
menugetgenericnode.doc: Returns the handle to the base node of the menu tree for the generic pages.

menugetnextchild.name: MenuGetNextChild
menugetnextchild.doc: Returns the next node that shares the same parent.

menugetpagenode.name: MenuGetPageNode
menugetpagenode.doc: Returns the handle to the base node of the menu tree of a specified page.

menugetparent.name: MenuGetParent
menugetparent.doc: Returns the parent node of the menu item.

menugetprevchild.name: MenuGetPrevChild
menugetprevchild.doc: Returns the previous node that shares the same parent.

menugetwindownode.name: MenuGetWindowNode
menugetwindownode.doc: Returns the handle to the root node for a given window.

menunodeaddchild.name: MenuNodeAddChild
menunodeaddchild.doc: Dynamically add a new item to the menu at runtime.

menunodegetcurr.name: MenuNodeGetCurr
menunodegetcurr.doc: Return the item value of the specified menu node.

menunodegetdepth.name: MenuNodeGetDepth
menunodegetdepth.doc: Return the item value of the specified menu node.

menunodegetexpanded.name: MenuNodeGetExpanded
menunodegetexpanded.doc: Returns the expansion state value of the specified menu node.

menunodegetproperty.name: MenuNodeGetProperty
menunodegetproperty.doc: Return the item value of the specified menu node.

menunodegettargetpage.name: MenuNodeGetTargetPage
menunodegettargetpage.doc: Return the item value of the specified menu node.

menunodehascommand.name: MenuNodeHasCommand

menunodeisdisabled.name: MenuNodeIsDisabled

menunodeishidden.name: MenuNodeIsHidden
menunodeishidden.doc: Checks whether the menu node is hidden by evaluating its HiddenWhen Cicode expression.

menunoderemove.name: MenuNodeRemove
menunoderemove.doc: Remove the menu node from the menu tree.

menunoderuncommand.name: MenuNodeRunCommand
menunoderuncommand.doc: Run the associated command for a menu node.

sqlconnect.doc: Creates an internal database connection object and tries to connect it to a database specified by the connection string.

sqlcreate.name: SQLCreate
sqlcreate.doc: Creates an internal DB connection object and returns a handle to the object for use by the other DB functions.

sqldisconnect.name: SQLDisconnect
sqldisconnect.doc: Closes the SQL connection to a database and disposes the DB connection object specified by the function parameter.

sqldispose.name: SQLDispose
sqldispose.doc: Closes the SQL connection to a database and disposes the DB connection object specified by the function parameter.

sqlend.name: SQLEnd
sqlend.doc: SQLEnd() releases the memory that was allocated when the last query was executed via SQLExec.

sqlerrmsg.name: SQLErrMsg
sqlerrmsg.doc: Returns an error message from either a particular data object or entire data system.

sqlexec.name: SQLExec
sqlexec.doc: Executes an SQL query on a database.

sqlfieldinfo.name: SQLFieldInfo
sqlfieldinfo.doc: Gets information about the fields or columns selected by a SQL query.

sqlgetfield.name: SQLGetField
sqlgetfield.doc: Gets field or column data from a database field.

sqlgetrecordset.name: SQLGetRecordset
sqlgetrecordset.doc: Executes an SQL query on a database and returns a handle to any resulting disconnected recordset.

sqlgetscalar.name: SQLGetScalar
sqlgetscalar.doc: Executes an SQL query on a database.

sqlinfo.name: SQLInfo
sqlinfo.doc: Gets information about a database connection, recordset or query properties.

sqlisnullfield.name: SQLIsNullField
sqlisnullfield.doc: Checks presence of null value in field from a recordset.

sqlnext.name: SQLNext
sqlnext.doc: Gets the next database record from an SQL query.

sqlnofields.name: SQLNoFields
sqlnofields.doc: When the hGeneral is the connection handle, the function returns the number of fields or columns that were returned by the last SQL statement.

sqlnumchange.name: SQLNumChange
sqlnumchange.doc: Gets the number of records that were modified in the last SQL Insert, Update, or Delete statement.

sqlnumfields.name: SQLNumFields
sqlnumfields.doc: When hGeneral is the connection handle, the function returns the number of fields or columns that were returned by the last SQL statement.

sqlopen.name: SQLOpen
sqlopen.doc: Opens an SQL connection between the DB connection object specified by the function's parameter and the database defined by the connection string given before as the parameter to either SQLCreate or SQLConnect function.

sqlparamsclearall.name: SQLParamsClearAll
sqlparamsclearall.doc: Remove all parameters associated with a particular connection object.

sqlparamssetasint.name: SQLParamsSetAsInt
sqlparamssetasint.doc: Adds or replace a parameterized query parameter and its value in the specified connection.

sqlparamssetasreal.name: SQLParamsSetAsReal
sqlparamssetasreal.doc: Adds or replaces a parameterized query's parameter and its value in the specified connection.

sqlparamssetasstring.name: SQLParamsSetAsString
sqlparamssetasstring.doc: Adds or replaces a parameterized query's parameter and its value in the specified connection.

sqlprev.name: SQLPrev
sqlprev.doc: Gets the previous database record from an SQL query.

sqlquerycreate.name: SQLQueryCreate
sqlquerycreate.doc: The function creates a new query and returns its handle.

sqlquerydispose.name: SQLQueryDispose
sqlquerydispose.doc: The function disposes the query which handle is given as the argument.

sqlrollback.name: SQLRollBack
sqlrollback.doc: Rolls back (discards) all changes made to the database within the current transaction.

sqlrowcount.name: SQLRowCount
sqlrowcount.doc: Gets the number of rows in the recordset.

sqlset.name: SQLSet
sqlset.doc: Sets a query string in the SQL buffer.

sqltraceoff.name: SQLTraceOff
sqltraceoff.doc: Turns off the debug trace. Use this function to stop tracing function calls that are made to the database.

sqltraceon.name: SQLTraceOn
sqltraceon.doc: Turns on a debug trace. Use this function to begin tracing function calls that are made to the database.

sqrt.name: Sqrt
sqrt.doc: Gets the square root of a number.

strcalcwidth.name: StrCalcWidth
strcalcwidth.doc: Retrieves the pixel width of a string using a particular font.

strclean.name: StrClean
strclean.doc: Removes control characters from a string.

strfill.name: StrFill
strfill.doc: Fills a string with a number of occurrences of another string.

strformat.name: StrFormat
strformat.doc: Converts a variable into a formatted string.

strgetchar.name: StrGetChar
strgetchar.doc: Gets a single character from a string or buffer. Use this function to read a string, character by character.

strleft.name: StrLeft
strleft.doc: Gets the left-most characters from a string.

strlength.name: StrLength
strlength.doc: Gets the length of a string.

strmid.name: StrMid
strmid.doc: Gets characters from the middle of a string.

strpad.name: StrPad
strpad.doc: Pads a string with a number of occurrences of another string.

strright.name: StrRight
strright.doc: Gets the rightmost characters from a string.

strsearch.name: StrSearch
strsearch.doc: Searches for a string within a string, commencing at a specified offset.

strsetchar.name: StrSetChar
strsetchar.doc: Sets a single character into a string or buffer.

strtochar.name: StrToChar
strtochar.doc: Gets the ASCII code of the first character in a string.

strtodate.name: StrToDate
strtodate.doc: Converts a "date" string into a time/date variable.

strtofmt.name: StrToFmt
strtofmt.doc: Converts a string into field data for a format template.

strtogrp.name: StrToGrp
strtogrp.doc: Converts a string into a group and places it into a group number.

strtohex.name: StrToHex
strtohex.doc: Converts a hexadecimal string into an integer.

strtoint.name: StrToInt
strtoint.doc: Converts a string into an integer.

strtolines.name: StrToLines
strtolines.doc: Converts a string into separate lines that contain no more than the number of characters specified in the MaxChars argument.

strtolocaltext.name: StrToLocalText
strtolocaltext.doc: Converts a native string into the local version of that string.

strtoperiod.name: StrToPeriod
strtoperiod.doc: Converts a string into a time period.

strtoreal.name: StrToReal
strtoreal.doc: Converts a string into a floating-point number.

strtotime.name: StrToTime
strtotime.doc: Converts a "time" string into a time/date variable.

strtotimestamp.name: StrToTimestamp
strtotimestamp.doc: This function  converts timestamp in a STRING format into a TIMESTAMP format.

strtovalue.name: StrToValue
strtovalue.doc: Converts a string into a floating-point number.

strtrim.name: StrTrim
strtrim.doc: Removes leading and trailing spaces from a string. Internal spaces are not removed from the string.

strtruncfont.name: StrTruncFont
strtruncfont.doc: Returns the truncated string using a particular font (specified by name) or the specified number of characters.

strtruncfonthnd.name: StrTruncFontHnd
strtruncfonthnd.doc: Returns the truncated string using a particular font (specified by font number) or the specified number of characters.

strword.name: StrWord
strword.doc: Gets the first word from a string. The word is removed from the string to allow the function to be repeated.

subscriptionaddcallback.name: SubscriptionAddCallback
subscriptionaddcallback.doc: Adds a function callback to a tag subscription.

subscriptiongetattribute.name: SubscriptionGetAttribute
subscriptiongetattribute.doc: Reads the specified attribute value of a subscribed tag.

subscriptiongetinfo.name: SubscriptionGetInfo
subscriptiongetinfo.doc: Reads the specified text information about a subscribed tag.

subscriptiongetquality.name: SubscriptionGetQuality
subscriptiongetquality.doc: Reads quality of a subscribed tag.

subscriptiongettag.name: SubscriptionGetTag
subscriptiongettag.doc: Reads a value, quality and timestamps of a subscribed tag.

subscriptiongettimestamp.name: SubscriptionGetTimestamp
subscriptiongettimestamp.doc: Reads the specified timestamp of a subscribed tag.

subscriptiongetvalue.name: SubscriptionGetValue
subscriptiongetvalue.doc: Reads a value of a subscribed tag.

subscriptionremovecallback.name: SubscriptionRemoveCallback
subscriptionremovecallback.doc: Removes a function callback from a tag subscription.

switchconfig.name: SwitchConfig
switchconfig.doc: Switches focus to a specific Plant SCADA configuration application.

systime.name: SysTime
systime.doc: Gets the  internal system millisecond counter. The counter is not based on time, but counts from 0 up to the maximum integer value and then back to 0.

systimedelta.name: SysTimeDelta
systimedelta.doc: Calculates the time difference between a start time and the current time, and updates the start time to the current time.

tablelookup.name: TableLookup
tablelookup.doc: Searches for a value in a table, and returns the position (offset) of the value in the table.

tablemath.name: TableMath
tablemath.doc: Performs mathematical operations on a table of real (floating-point) numbers.

tableshift.name: TableShift
tableshift.doc: Shifts table items in a table by a number of positions.

tagbrowseclose.name: TagBrowseClose
tagbrowseclose.doc: The TagBrowseClose function terminates an active data browse session and cleans up resources associated with the session.

tagbrowsefirst.name: TagBrowseFirst
tagbrowsefirst.doc: The TagBrowseFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

tagbrowsegetfield.name: TagBrowseGetField
tagbrowsegetfield.doc: The TagBrowseGetField function retrieves the value of the specified field from the record the data browse cursor is currently referencing.

tagbrowsenext.name: TagBrowseNext
tagbrowsenext.doc: The TagBrowseNext function moves the data browse cursor forward one record.

tagbrowsenumrecords.name: TagBrowseNumRecords
tagbrowsenumrecords.doc: The TagBrowseNumRecords function gets the number of records for a given browsing session.

tagbrowseopen.name: TagBrowseOpen
tagbrowseopen.doc: The TagBrowseOpen function initiates a new browse session and returns a handle to the new session that can be used in subsequent data browse function calls.

tagbrowseprev.name: TagBrowsePrev
tagbrowseprev.doc: The TagBrowsePrev function moves the data browse cursor back one record.

tagdebug.name: TagDebug
tagdebug.doc: Displays a dialog which allows you to select from a list of the configured variable tags in your system.

tagdebugform.name: TagDebugForm
tagdebugform.doc: The TagDebugForm Cicode function displays a dialog that allows you to select a variable tag and perform some basic read/write operations on it.

tageventformat.name: TagEventFormat
tageventformat.doc: Returns a handle to the format of the data used by the TagEventQueue().

tageventqueue.name: TagEventQueue
tageventqueue.doc: Opens the tag update event queue. The I/O server writes events into this queue as they are processed.

taggetproperty.name: TagGetProperty
taggetproperty.doc: This function reads a property of a variable tag from the data source. This function replaces TagInfo.

taggetscale.name: TagGetScale
taggetscale.doc: Gets the value of a tag at a specified scale from the datasource.

taginfo.name: TagInfo
taginfo.doc: Gets information about a variable tag. This function allows you to develop generic Cicode and Super Genies.

taginfoex.name: TagInfoEx
taginfoex.doc: This function replaces TagInfo and is identical in operation. It supports online changes.

tagramp.name: TagRamp
tagramp.doc: This function will increment a Tag by the amount defined by iPercentInc. It is often used for incrementing a tag while a button is held down.

tagrdbreload.name: TagRDBReload
tagrdbreload.doc: Works in conjunction with the TagInfo function. Reloads the variable tag database so when TagInfo is called it picks up all online changes to the tag database.

tagread.name: TagRead
tagread.doc: Reads a variable from an I/O device or a local variable.

tagreadex.name: TagReadEx
tagreadex.doc: Reads the value, quality or timestamp of a particular tag from the I/O device.

tagresolve.name: TagResolve
tagresolve.doc: This function can be used to increment a reference count on a tag to keep it resolved, making it readily available to a client.

tagscalestr.name: TagScaleStr
tagscalestr.doc: Gets the value of a tag at a specified scale.

tagsetoverridebad.name: TagSetOverrideBad
tagsetoverridebad.doc: Sets a quality Override element for a specified tag to Bad Non Specific.

tagsetoverridegood.name: TagSetOverrideGood
tagsetoverridegood.doc: Sets a quality Override element for a specified tag to Good Non Specific.

tagsetoverridequality.name: TagSetOverrideQuality
tagsetoverridequality.doc: Sets a quality of Override element for a specified tag.

tagsetoverrideuncertain.name: TagSetOverrideUncertain
tagsetoverrideuncertain.doc: Sets a quality Override element for a specified tag to Uncertain Non Specific.

tagsubscribe.name: TagSubscribe
tagsubscribe.doc: Subscribes a tag so that Cicode functions can be called when a tag's value changes.

tagunresolve.name: TagUnresolve
tagunresolve.doc: This function is used to decrement a reference count implemented on a tag by TagResolve.

tagunsubscribe.name: TagUnsubscribe
tagunsubscribe.doc: Unsubscribes the tag subscription specified by the integer subscription handle that was returned from the TagSubscribe function.

tagwrite.name: TagWrite
tagwrite.doc: Writes to an I/O device variable by specifying the variable tag name or the variable tag name and the name of the requested element having read/write access.

tagwriteeventque.name: TagWriteEventQue
tagwriteeventque.doc: Opens the tag write event queue. The TagWriteEventQue is a queue of data containing details of tag value changes initiated by the process.

tagwriteintarray.name: TagWriteIntArray
tagwriteintarray.doc: This function writes an array of integers to a tag.

tagwriterealarray.name: TagWriteRealArray
tagwriterealarray.doc: This function writes an array of REAL values to a variable tag.

tan.name: Tan
tan.doc: Calculates the trigonometric tangent of an angle.

taskcall.name: TaskCall
taskcall.doc: Calls a Cicode function by specifying the function name and providing an arguments string.

taskcluster.name: TaskCluster
taskcluster.doc: Gets the name of the cluster context in which the current task is executing.

taskgetsignal.name: TaskGetSignal
taskgetsignal.doc: Retrieves a value that indicates the signal that is currently set for a specific task.

taskhnd.name: TaskHnd
taskhnd.doc: Gets the task handle of a specific task. You can then use the task handle with other task functions to control the task.

taskkill.name: TaskKill
taskkill.doc: Kills a task. The Cicode task will be stopped and will not run again.

tasknew.name: TaskNew
tasknew.doc: Creates a new Cicode task and returns the task handle.

tasknewex.name: TaskNewEx
tasknewex.doc: Creates a new Cicode task with an individual subscription rate and returns the task handle.

taskresume.name: TaskResume
taskresume.doc: Resumes a task that was suspended by the TaskSuspend() function. After a task is resumed, it runs on the next time-slice.

tasksetsignal.name: TaskSetSignal
tasksetsignal.doc: Manually applies a signal to a specified task.

tasksuspend.name: TaskSuspend
tasksuspend.doc: Suspends a task. The task will stop running and will start again only when TaskResume() is called.

testrandomwave.name: TestRandomWave
testrandomwave.doc: Generates a random wave. The height of the wave is restricted by minimum and maximum values.

testsawwave.name: TestSawWave
testsawwave.doc: Generates a saw wave. The height of the wave is restricted by minimum and maximum values.

testsinwave.name: TestSinWave
testsinwave.doc: Generates a sine wave. The height of the wave is restricted by minimum and maximum values.

testsquarewave.name: TestSquareWave
testsquarewave.doc: Generates a square wave. The height of the wave is restricted by minimum and maximum values.

testtriangwave.name: TestTriangWave
testtriangwave.doc: Generates a triangular wave. The height of the wave is restricted by minimum and maximum values.

timecurrent.name: TimeCurrent
timecurrent.doc: Gets the current system time/date in time/date variable format.

timehour.name: TimeHour
timehour.doc: Gets the hour value from a time/date variable.

timeinfo.name: TimeInfo
timeinfo.doc: Returns the time format currently used on the Plant SCADA Server.

timeinttotimestamp.name: TimeIntToTimestamp
timeinttotimestamp.doc: Converts a time INTEGER which is represented as a number of seconds since 01/01/1970 to a TIMESTAMP.

timemidnight.name: TimeMidNight
timemidnight.doc: Returns the number of seconds between midnight on January 1, 1970, and the midnight immediately prior to the specified time/date.

timemin.name: TimeMin
timemin.doc: Gets the minutes value from a time/date variable.

timesec.name: TimeSec
timesec.doc: Gets the seconds value from a time/date variable.

timeset.name: TimeSet
timeset.doc: Sets the new system time. You can set the time only on the computer which this function is called.

timestampadd.name: TimestampAdd
timestampadd.doc: Adds an offset to a TIMESTAMP variable.

timestampcreate.name: TimestampCreate
timestampcreate.doc: Returns a TIMESTAMP variable created from the parts.

timestampcurrent.name: TimestampCurrent
timestampcurrent.doc: Return the current system date and time as a TIMESTAMP variable.

timestampdifference.name: TimestampDifference
timestampdifference.doc: Returns the difference between two TIMESTAMP variables as a number of milliseconds.

timestampformat.name: TimestampFormat
timestampformat.doc: Formats a TIMESTAMP variable into a string.

timestampgetpart.name: TimestampGetPart
timestampgetpart.doc: Returns one part (year, month, day, etc) of the TIMESTAMP variable.

timestampsub.name: TimestampSub
timestampsub.doc: Subtracts an offset from a TIMESTAMP variable.

timestamptostr.name: TimestampToStr
timestamptostr.doc: Converts a TIMESTAMP variable into a string.

timestamptotimeint.name: TimestampToTimeInt
timestamptotimeint.doc: Converts a TIMESTAMP variable into a time INTEGER which is represented as a number of seconds since 01/01/1970.

timetooledate.name: TimeToOLEDate
timetooledate.doc: Converts a time/date value to an OLE DATE value (this should be stored in a REAL).

timetostr.name: TimeToStr
timetostr.doc: Converts a time/date variable into a string. Use this function for calculating time differences or run times, and so on.

timeutcoffset.name: TimeUTCOffset
timeutcoffset.doc: Determines the local time bias from UTC that was in force at a specified time.

time.name: Time
time.doc: Gets the current time in string format.

toggle.name: Toggle
toggle.doc: Toggles a digital tag on or off. If the variable tag is ON (1), this function will turn it OFF.

tracemsg.name: TraceMsg
tracemsg.doc: Displays a message in the Kernel and Debugger debug windows.

trenddspcursorcomment.name: TrendDspCursorComment
trenddspcursorcomment.doc: Displays the Trend Comment for the currently selected pen on the displayed trend graph.

trenddspcursorscale.name: TrendDspCursorScale
trenddspcursorscale.doc: Displays a scale value for the current pen in the current pen font.

trenddspcursortag.name: TrendDspCursorTag
trenddspcursortag.doc: Displays the trend tag name of the current pen in the pen font.

trenddspcursortime.name: TrendDspCursorTime
trenddspcursortime.doc: Displays the cursor time of the current pen in the current pen font.

trenddspcursorvalue.name: TrendDspCursorValue
trenddspcursorvalue.doc: Display the cursor value of the current pen in the current pen font.

trendgetan.name: TrendGetAn
trendgetan.doc: Gets the AN number of the trend beneath the current mouse position.

trendpopup.name: TrendPopUp
trendpopup.doc: Displays a pop-up trend with the specified trend pens.

trendrun.name: TrendRun
trendrun.doc: Initializes the cursor and rubber-band features on a trend page.

trendsetdate.name: TrendSetDate
trendsetdate.doc: Sets the end date for all pens on a trend. Samples taken after this date will not be displayed.

trendsetscale.name: TrendSetScale
trendsetscale.doc: Sets the scale of the current pen or of all pens on a trend.

trendsetspan.name: TrendSetSpan
trendsetspan.doc: Sets the span time of the trend. The span time is the time period covered in the trend window.

trendsettime.name: TrendSetTime
trendsettime.doc: Sets the end time for all the pens on a trend. Samples taken after this time will not be displayed.

trendsettimebase.name: TrendSetTimebase
trendsettimebase.doc: Sets a new sampling period for a trend.

trendwin.name: TrendWin
trendwin.doc: Displays a trend page (in a new window) with the specified trend pens.

trendzoom.name: TrendZoom
trendzoom.doc: Zooms" a specified trend in either one or both axes.

trnaddhistory.name: TrnAddHistory
trnaddhistory.doc: Adds an old (backed up) trend history file to the trend system so that its data can be used.

trnbrowseclose.name: TrnBrowseClose
trnbrowseclose.doc: The TrnBrowseClose function terminates an active data browse session and cleans up all resources associated with the session.

trnbrowsefirst.name: TrnBrowseFirst
trnbrowsefirst.doc: The TrnBrowseFirst function places the data browse cursor at the first record.

trnbrowsegetfield.name: TrnBrowseGetField
trnbrowsegetfield.doc: The TrnBrowseGetField function retrieves the value of the specified field from the record the data browse cursor is currently referencing.

trnbrowsenext.name: TrnBrowseNext
trnbrowsenext.doc: The TrnBrowseNext function moves the data browse cursor forward one record.

trnbrowsenumrecords.name: TrnBrowseNumRecords
trnbrowsenumrecords.doc: The TrnBrowseNumRecords function returns the number of records that match the filter criteria.

trnbrowseopen.name: TrnBrowseOpen
trnbrowseopen.doc: The TrnBrowseOpen function initiates a new browse session and returns a handle to the new session that can be used in subsequent data browse function calls.

trnbrowseprev.name: TrnBrowsePrev
trnbrowseprev.doc: The TrnBrowsePrev function moves the data browse cursor back one record.

trnclientinfo.name: TrnClientInfo
trnclientinfo.doc: Gets information about the trend that is being displayed at the AN point.

trncompareplot.name: TrnComparePlot
trncompareplot.doc: Prints two trends, one overlaid on the other.

trndelete.name: TrnDelete
trndelete.doc: Deletes a trend that is displayed on a current page.

trndelhistory.name: TrnDelHistory
trndelhistory.doc: Removes a trend history file that has been added to the trend system by the TrnAddHistory() function.

trnecho.name: TrnEcho
trnecho.doc: Enables and disables the echo of the trend display.

trneventgettable.name: TrnEventGetTable
trneventgettable.doc: Stores event trend data in an event table and the associated time stamp in a time table, for a specified trend tag.

trneventgettablems.name: TrnEventGetTableMS
trneventgettablems.doc: Stores event trend data and time data (including milliseconds) for a specified trend tag.

trneventsettable.name: TrnEventSetTable
trneventsettable.doc: Adds new event to a trend, or overwrites existing points with new values.

trneventsettablems.name: TrnEventSetTableMS
trneventsettablems.doc: Sets event trend data and time data (including milliseconds) for a specified trend tag.

trnexportclip.name: TrnExportClip
trnexportclip.doc: Exports trend data to the Windows Clipboard.

trnexportcsv.name: TrnExportCSV
trnexportcsv.doc: Exports trend data to a file in CSV (Comma Separated Variable) format.

trnexportdbf.name: TrnExportDBF
trnexportdbf.doc: Exports trend data to a file in dBASE III format.

trnflush.name: TrnFlush
trnflush.doc: Writes acquired trend data to disk without waiting for the trend buffer to be filled.

trngetbufevent.name: TrnGetBufEvent
trngetbufevent.doc: Gets the event number of a trend at an offset for a specified pen.

trngetbuftime.name: TrnGetBufTime
trngetbuftime.doc: Gets the time and date of a trend at an offset for a specified pen.

trngetbufvalue.name: TrnGetBufValue
trngetbufvalue.doc: Gets the value of a trend at an offset for a specified pen.

trngetcluster.name: TrnGetCluster
trngetcluster.doc: Gets the cluster name of a trend graph on a page.

trngetcursorevent.name: TrnGetCursorEvent
trngetcursorevent.doc: Gets the event number of a trend, at the trend cursor position for a specified pen.

trngetcursormstime.name: TrnGetCursorMSTime
trngetcursormstime.doc: Gets the time (in milliseconds from the previous midnight) at a trend cursor for a specified pen.

trngetcursorpos.name: TrnGetCursorPos
trngetcursorpos.doc: Gets the offset of a trend cursor from its origin, in samples.

trngetcursortime.name: TrnGetCursorTime
trngetcursortime.doc: Gets the time and date at a trend cursor for a specified pen.

trngetcursorvalue.name: TrnGetCursorValue
trngetcursorvalue.doc: Gets the value at a trend cursor for a specified pen.

trngetcursorvaluestr.name: TrnGetCursorValueStr
trngetcursorvaluestr.doc: Gets the value at a trend cursor for a specified pen.

trngetdefscale.name: TrnGetDefScale
trngetdefscale.doc: Gets the default engineering zero and full scales of a trend tag.

trngetdisplaymode.name: TrnGetDisplayMode
trngetdisplaymode.doc: Returns the display mode of the selected trend pen.

trngetevent.name: TrnGetEvent
trngetevent.doc: Gets the event number of the trend at a percentage along the trend, using the current event as the base point.

trngetformat.name: TrnGetFormat
trngetformat.doc: Gets the format of a trend tag being plotted by a specified pen.

trngetgatedvalue.name: TrnGetGatedValue
trngetgatedvalue.doc: Returns the internally stored value for <GATED>.

trngetinvalidvalue.name: TrnGetInvalidValue
trngetinvalidvalue.doc: Returns the internally stored value for <INVALID>.

trngetmode.name: TrnGetMode
trngetmode.doc: Gets the mode (real-time or historical trending) of the trend pen.

trngetmstime.name: TrnGetMSTime
trngetmstime.doc: Gets the time (in milliseconds from the previous midnight) of the trend (plotted by a specified pen) at a percentage along the trend, using the time and date of the right-most sample displayed.

trngetpen.name: TrnGetPen
trngetpen.doc: Gets the trend tag being plotted by a specified pen.

trngetpencomment.name: TrnGetPenComment
trngetpencomment.doc: Retrieves the comment of a pen.

trngetpenfocus.name: TrnGetPenFocus
trngetpenfocus.doc: Gets the number of the pen currently in focus.

trngetpenno.name: TrnGetPenNo
trngetpenno.doc: Gets the pen number of a pen name.

trngetperiod.name: TrnGetPeriod
trngetperiod.doc: Gets the current display period of a trend.

trngetscale.name: TrnGetScale
trngetscale.doc: Gets the display scale of the trend tag being plotted by a specified pen.

trngetscalestr.name: TrnGetScaleStr
trngetscalestr.doc: Gets the scale of the trend tag being plotted by a specified pen.

trngetspan.name: TrnGetSpan
trngetspan.doc: Gets the span time of a trend (if the span was set by the TrnSetSpan() function).

trngettable.name: TrnGetTable
trngettable.doc: This function allows you to tabulate values from a specific section of trend. The values in the table (possibly an array variable) are arranged by time.

trngettime.name: TrnGetTime
trngettime.doc: Gets the time and date of the trend (plotted by a specified pen) at a percentage along the trend, using the time and date of the right-most sample displayed.

trngetunits.name: TrnGetUnits
trngetunits.doc: Gets the data units for the trend tag plotted by a specified Pen.

trninfo.name: TrnInfo
trninfo.doc: Gets the configured values of a trend tag.

trnisvalidvalue.name: TrnIsValidValue
trnisvalidvalue.doc: Determines whether a logged trend value is <VALID>, <GATED> or <INVALID>.

trnnew.name: TrnNew
trnnew.doc: Creates a new trend at run time.

trnplot.name: TrnPlot
trnplot.doc: Prints the trend line of one or more trend tags.

trnprint.name: TrnPrint
trnprint.doc: Prints the trend that is displayed on the screen (at nAN) using the current display mode for each trend.

trnsamplesconfigured.name: TrnSamplesConfigured
trnsamplesconfigured.doc: Gets the number of samples configured for the currently displayed trend.

trnscroll.name: TrnScroll
trnscroll.doc: Scrolls the trend pen by a specified percentage (of span), or number of samples.

trnselect.name: TrnSelect
trnselect.doc: Sets up a page for a trend. This function allows you to set up a trend before the trend page is displayed.

trnsetcursor.name: TrnSetCursor
trnsetcursor.doc: Moves the trend cursor by a specified number of samples.

trnsetcursorpos.name: TrnSetCursorPos
trnsetcursorpos.doc: Moves the trend cursor to a specified x-axis point, offset from the trend cursor origin.

trnsetdisplaymode.name: TrnSetDisplayMode
trnsetdisplaymode.doc: Specifies how raw trend samples are displayed on the screen.

trnsetevent.name: TrnSetEvent
trnsetevent.doc: Sets the start event of a trend pen. This function only operates on an event-based trend.

trnsetpen.name: TrnSetPen
trnsetpen.doc: Sets the trend tag of a trend pen. The trend pen changes to the specified tag and the trend is refreshed.

trnsetpenfocus.name: TrnSetPenFocus
trnsetpenfocus.doc: Sets the focus to a specified pen.

trnsetperiod.name: TrnSetPeriod
trnsetperiod.doc: Sets the display period (time base) of a trend.

trnsetscale.name: TrnSetScale
trnsetscale.doc: Sets a new scale for a trend pen.

trnsetspan.name: TrnSetSpan
trnsetspan.doc: Sets the span time of a trend. The span time is the total time displayed in the trend window.

trnsettable.name: TrnSetTable
trnsettable.doc: Writes trend tag data from a table to the trend logging system.

trnsettime.name: TrnSetTime
trnsettime.doc: Sets the end time and date of a trend pen.

usercreate.name: UserCreate
usercreate.doc: Creates a record for a new user.  Not available for a Windows user.

usercreateform.name: UserCreateForm
usercreateform.doc: Displays a form to create a record for a new user. Not available for a Windows user.

userdelete.name: UserDelete
userdelete.doc: Deletes the record for a user.  Not available for a Windows user.

usereditform.name: UserEditForm
usereditform.doc: Displays a form to allow the user to create or delete any user record in the database. Not available for a Windows user.

userinfo.name: UserInfo
userinfo.doc: Gets information about the operator who is currently logged-in to the system.

userlogin.name: UserLogin
userlogin.doc: Logs a user into the Plant SCADA system, using either Windows integrated security or Plant SCADA security.

userpassword.name: UserPassword
userpassword.doc: Changes the password for the user.  Not available for a Windows user.

userpasswordexpirydays.name: UserPasswordExpiryDays
userpasswordexpirydays.doc: Returns the number of days left before the user's password is due to expire. Not available for a Windows user.

userpasswordform.name: UserPasswordForm
userpasswordform.doc: Display a form to allow users to change their own passwords. Not available for a Windows user.

usersetstr.name: UserSetStr
usersetstr.doc: Sets the value of the given field for the given user record in the project configuration (users.dbf ) on the local machine.

userupdaterecord.name: UserUpdateRecord
userupdaterecord.doc: Triggers a recompile of the local project configuration, then notifies the running system that user configuration has been modified and needs to be reloaded.

userverify.name: UserVerify
userverify.doc: Verifies a given user by authenticating the user's credential, verifies the user privileges and areas against those specified in the functions parameters.

variablequality.name: VariableQuality
variablequality.doc: Extracts the quality from a given variable.

variabletimestamp.name: VariableTimestamp
variabletimestamp.doc: Extracts the timestamp from a given variable.

verifyprivilegeform.name: VerifyPrivilegeForm
verifyprivilegeform.doc: Displays a form that allows a single user to enter their credentials.

verifyprivilegetagwrite.name: VerifyPrivilegeTagWrite
verifyprivilegetagwrite.doc: Displays a form that allows any single user to enter their credentials in order to approve a write of a specific value to a specific tag.

version.name: Version
version.doc: Gets the version number of the Plant SCADA software in use.

whoami.name: WhoAmI
whoami.doc: Displays the user name and full name of the user currently logged-in to the system.

wincopy.name: WinCopy
wincopy.doc: Copies the graphics image of the active window to the Windows Clipboard.

winfile.name: WinFile
winfile.doc: Writes the graphics image of the active window to a file.

wingetclicked.name: WinGetClicked
wingetclicked.doc: Gets the number of the Plant SCADA window that has most recently been clicked on using the left mouse button.

wingetfirstchild.name: WinGetFirstChild
wingetfirstchild.doc: Gets the window number of the first child of a parent window.

wingetfocus.name: WinGetFocus
wingetfocus.doc: Gets the number of the Plant SCADA window that has the keyboard focus.

wingetname.name: WinGetName
wingetname.doc: Gets the name previously associated with a particular window number using WinSetName.

wingetnextchild.name: WinGetNextChild
wingetnextchild.doc: Gets the window number of the next child in a child link.

wingetparent.name: WinGetParent
wingetparent.doc: Retrieves the Window Number of the specified window's parent or root window.

wingetwndhnd.name: WinGetWndHnd
wingetwndhnd.doc: Gets the window handle for the current window.

wingoto.name: WinGoto
wingoto.doc: Changes the active window. The specified window is placed in front of all other windows and all keyboard commands will apply to this window.

winmode.name: WinMode
winmode.doc: Sets the display mode of the active Plant SCADA window.

winmove.name: WinMove
winmove.doc: Moves the active window to a new location and sizes the window in a single operation.

winnew.name: WinNew
winnew.doc: Opens a new display window, with a specified page displayed.

winnewat.name: WinNewAt
winnewat.doc: Opens a new display window at a specified location, with a selected page displayed.

winnewpinat.name: WinNewPinAt
winnewpinat.doc: Opens a new display window at a specified location, relative to the current active window, with a selected page displayed.

winnext.name: WinNext
winnext.doc: Makes the next window (in order of creation) active.

winnumber.name: WinNumber
winnumber.doc: Gets the window number of the active Plant SCADA window.

winpos.name: WinPos
winpos.doc: Moves the active window to a new location.

winprev.name: WinPrev
winprev.doc: Makes the previous window (in order of creation) active.

winprint.name: WinPrint
winprint.doc: Sends the graphics image of the active window to a printer.

winprintfile.name: WinPrintFile
winprintfile.doc: Prints a file to the system printer.

winselect.name: WinSelect
winselect.doc: Selects a window to make active. This function only affects the output of Cicode functions.

winsetname.name: WinSetName
winsetname.doc: Associates a name with a particular window by its window number.

winsize.name: WinSize
winsize.doc: Sizes the active window. The origin of the window does not move.

winstyle.name: WinStyle
winstyle.doc: Switches on and off scrolling and scrollbar features for existing windows.

wintitle.name: WinTitle
wintitle.doc: If a window title has been set with the [Page]WinTitle parameter, Plant SCADA uses this title when it refreshes the page (overriding the window title set with the WinTitle() function).

wndfind.name: WndFind
wndfind.doc: Gets the Windows handle of any window of any application, so that the window can be manipulated.

wndgetfileprofile.name: WndGetFileProfile
wndgetfileprofile.doc: Gets a profile string from any .ini file.

wndhelp.name: WndHelp
wndhelp.doc: Invokes the Windows Help application (WinHlp32.EXE) to display a specific topic from a specific help file.

wndinfo.name: WndInfo
wndinfo.doc: Gets information on the window system (such as the width and height of the various elements displayed by Windows).

wndmonitorinfo.name: WndMonitorInfo
wndmonitorinfo.doc: Returns information about a particular monitor.

wndmonitorinfoex.name: WndMonitorInfoEx
wndmonitorinfoex.doc: Returns information about a particular monitor.

wndputfileprofile.name: WndPutFileProfile
wndputfileprofile.doc: Puts a profile string into any .INI file.

wndshow.name: WndShow
wndshow.doc: Sets the display mode of any window of any application.

xmlclose.name: XMLClose
xmlclose.doc: Use this function to delete an XML document in memory.

xmlcreate.name: XMLCreate
xmlcreate.doc: Use this function to create  a new XML document in memory.

xmlgetattribute.name: XMLGetAttribute
xmlgetattribute.doc: Retrieves the attribute value of the node from an XML document in memory.

xmlgetattributecount.name: XMLGetAttributeCount
xmlgetattributecount.doc: Gets number of attribute of specified XML node.

xmlgetattributename.name: XMLGetAttributeName
xmlgetattributename.doc: Gets name of specified XML Node’s attribute by using attribute index.

xmlgetattributevalue.name: XMLGetAttributeValue
xmlgetattributevalue.doc: Gets the value of the specified XML node's attribute by using attribute index.

xmlgetchild.name: XMLGetChild
xmlgetchild.doc: Retrieves the child node for the specified parent node in XML document in memory.

xmlgetchildcount.name: XMLGetChildCount
xmlgetchildcount.doc: Retrieves the total number of child nodes for the specified parent node in an XML document in memory.

xmlgetparent.name: XMLGetParent
xmlgetparent.doc: Gets the parent of specified node.

xmlgetroot.name: XMLGetRoot
xmlgetroot.doc: Gets the root element of the specified XML document.

xmlnodeaddchild.name: XMLNodeAddChild
xmlnodeaddchild.doc: Creates an element node with the specified Name and Namespace and appends the node to the end of the list of child nodes of specified parent node in the XML document.

xmlnodefind.name: XMLNodeFind
xmlnodefind.doc: Use this function to select the first XML node that matches the XPath expression.

xmlnodegetname.name: XMLNodeGetName
xmlnodegetname.doc: Gets the name of the specified node.

xmlnodegetvalue.name: XMLNodeGetValue
xmlnodegetvalue.doc: Gets the value of the specified node.

xmlnoderemove.name: XMLNodeRemove
xmlnoderemove.doc: Removes the specified XML node from its parent and XML document.

xmlnodesetvalue.name: XMLNodeSetValue
xmlnodesetvalue.doc: Sets the value of the specified node.

xmlopen.name: XMLOpen
xmlopen.doc: Reads an XML file from disk to create XML document.

xmlsave.name: XMLSave
xmlsave.doc: Use this function to save  XML document on disk.

xmlsetattribute.name: XMLSetAttribute
xmlsetattribute.doc: Use this function to set the value of specified attribute of the node in the XML document. If the attribute does not exist, it will be created.

_objectcallmethod.name: _ObjectCallMethod
_objectcallmethod.doc: Calls a specific method for an ActiveX object.

_objectgetproperty.name: _ObjectGetProperty
_objectgetproperty.doc: Gets a specific property of an ActiveX object.

_objectsetproperty.name: _ObjectSetProperty
_objectsetproperty.doc: Sets a specific property of an ActiveX object.
